   <div class="mw-indicators mw-body-content">

   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    Ellipse
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div class="noprint" id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>
    <div class="mw-jump" id="jump-to-nav">
     Jump to:
     <a href="#mw-head">
      navigation
     </a>
     ,
     <a href="#p-search">
      search
     </a>
    </div>
    <div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en">
     <div class="mw-parser-output">
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       This article is about the geometric figure. For other uses, see
       <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/Ellipse_(disambiguation)" title="Ellipse (disambiguation)">
        Ellipse (disambiguation)
       </a>
       .
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       "Elliptical" redirects here. For the syntactic omission of words, see
       <a href="/wiki/Ellipsis_(linguistics)" title="Ellipsis (linguistics)">
        Ellipsis (linguistics)
       </a>
       . For the punctuation mark, see
       <a href="/wiki/Ellipsis" title="Ellipsis">
        Ellipsis
       </a>
       .
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-conic.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="416" data-file-width="432" height="212" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5f/Ellipse-conic.svg/220px-Ellipse-conic.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5f/Ellipse-conic.svg/330px-Ellipse-conic.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5f/Ellipse-conic.svg/440px-Ellipse-conic.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-conic.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         An ellipse (red) obtained as the intersection of a
         <a href="/wiki/Cone" title="Cone">
          cone
         </a>
         with an inclined plane
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-def0.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="256" data-file-width="331" height="232" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Ellipse-def0.svg/300px-Ellipse-def0.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Ellipse-def0.svg/450px-Ellipse-def0.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Ellipse-def0.svg/600px-Ellipse-def0.svg.png 2x" width="300"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-def0.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: notations
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-var.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="472" data-file-width="226" height="459" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Ellipse-var.svg/220px-Ellipse-var.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Ellipse-var.svg/330px-Ellipse-var.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Ellipse-var.svg/440px-Ellipse-var.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-var.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipses: examples
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       In
       <a href="/wiki/Mathematics" title="Mathematics">
        mathematics
       </a>
       , an
       <b>
        ellipse
       </b>
       is a
       <a href="/wiki/Plane_curve" title="Plane curve">
        curve in a plane
       </a>
       surrounding two
       <a href="/wiki/Focus_(geometry)" title="Focus (geometry)">
        focal points
       </a>
       such that the sum of the distances to the two focal points is constant for every point on the curve. As such, it is a generalization of a circle, which is a special type of an ellipse having both focal points at the same location. The shape of an ellipse (how "elongated" it is) is represented by its
       <a href="/wiki/Eccentricity_(mathematics)" title="Eccentricity (mathematics)">
        eccentricity
       </a>
       , which for an ellipse can be any number from 0 (the
       <a href="/wiki/Limiting_case_(mathematics)" title="Limiting case (mathematics)">
        limiting case
       </a>
       of a
       <a href="/wiki/Circle" title="Circle">
        circle
       </a>
       ) to arbitrarily close to but less than 1.
      </p>
      <p>
       Ellipses are the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Closed_curve" title="Closed curve">
        closed
       </a>
       type of
       <a href="/wiki/Conic_section" title="Conic section">
        conic section
       </a>
       : a plane curve resulting from the intersection of a
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cone_(geometry)" title="Cone (geometry)">
        cone
       </a>
       by a
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Plane_(mathematics)" title="Plane (mathematics)">
        plane
       </a>
       (see figure to the right). Ellipses have many similarities with the other two forms of conic sections:
       <a href="/wiki/Parabola" title="Parabola">
        parabolas
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Hyperbola" title="Hyperbola">
        hyperbolas
       </a>
       , both of which are
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Open_curve" title="Open curve">
        open
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Unbounded_set" title="Unbounded set">
        unbounded
       </a>
       . The
       <a href="/wiki/Cross_section_(geometry)" title="Cross section (geometry)">
        cross section
       </a>
       of a
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cylinder_(geometry)#Cylindric_section" title="Cylinder (geometry)">
        cylinder
       </a>
       is an ellipse, unless the section is parallel to the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Axis_of_rotation" title="Axis of rotation">
        axis
       </a>
       of the cylinder.
      </p>
      <p>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Analytical_geometry" title="Analytical geometry">
        Analytically
       </a>
       , an ellipse may also be defined as the set of points such that the ratio of the distance of each point on the curve from a given point (called a
       <a href="/wiki/Focus_(geometry)" title="Focus (geometry)">
        focus
       </a>
       or focal point) to the distance from that same point on the curve to a given line (called the
       <a href="/wiki/Ellipse#Definition_of_an_ellipse_by_the_directrix_property" title="Ellipse">
        directrix
       </a>
       ) is a constant. This ratio is called the eccentricity of the ellipse.
      </p>
      <p>
       An ellipse may also be defined analytically as the set of points for each of which the sum of its distances to two foci is a fixed number.
      </p>
      <p>
       Ellipses are common in physics, astronomy and engineering. For example, the
       <a href="/wiki/Orbit" title="Orbit">
        orbit
       </a>
       of each planet in our solar system is approximately an ellipse with the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Barycentric_coordinates_(astronomy)" title="Barycentric coordinates (astronomy)">
        barycenter
       </a>
       of the planet–Sun pair at one of the focal points. The same is true for moons orbiting planets and all other systems having two astronomical bodies. The shapes of planets and stars are often well described by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ellipsoids" title="Ellipsoids">
        ellipsoids
       </a>
       . Ellipses also arise as images of a circle under
       <a href="/wiki/Parallel_projection" title="Parallel projection">
        parallel projection
       </a>
       and the bounded cases of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Perspective_projection" title="Perspective projection">
        perspective projection
       </a>
       , which are simply intersections of the projective cone with the plane of projection. It is also the simplest
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lissajous_figure" title="Lissajous figure">
        Lissajous figure
       </a>
       formed when the horizontal and vertical motions are
       <a href="/wiki/Sine_wave" title="Sine wave">
        sinusoids
       </a>
       with the same frequency. A similar effect leads to
       <a href="/wiki/Elliptical_polarization" title="Elliptical polarization">
        elliptical polarization
       </a>
       of light in
       <a href="/wiki/Optics" title="Optics">
        optics
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       The name, ἔλλειψις (élleipsis, "omission"), was given by
       <a href="/wiki/Apollonius_of_Perga" title="Apollonius of Perga">
        Apollonius of Perga
       </a>
       in his
       <i>
        Conics
       </i>
       , emphasizing the connection of the curve with "application of areas".
      </p>
      <p>
      </p>
      <div class="toc" id="toc">

          </span>
         </a>
        </li>
        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-26">
         <a href="#Metric_properties">
          <span class="tocnumber">
           12
          </span>

      <p>
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Definition_of_an_ellipse_as_locus_of_points">
        Definition of an ellipse as locus of points
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Definition of an ellipse as locus of points">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-def-e.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="256" data-file-width="331" height="170" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Ellipse-def-e.svg/220px-Ellipse-def-e.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Ellipse-def-e.svg/330px-Ellipse-def-e.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Ellipse-def-e.svg/440px-Ellipse-def-e.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-def-e.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: Definition
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-def-dc.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="315" data-file-width="296" height="234" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c7/Ellipse-def-dc.svg/220px-Ellipse-def-dc.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c7/Ellipse-def-dc.svg/330px-Ellipse-def-dc.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c7/Ellipse-def-dc.svg/440px-Ellipse-def-dc.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-def-dc.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: definition with director circle
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       An ellipse can be defined geometrically as a set of points (
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Locus_of_points" title="Locus of points">
        locus of points
       </a>
       ) in the Euclidean plane:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        An
        <b>
         ellipse
        </b>
        is a set of points, such that for any point
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b4dc73bf40314945ff376bd363916a738548d40a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.745ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        of the set, the sum of the distances
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle |PF_{1}|,\ |PF_{2}|}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle |PF_{1}|,\ |PF_{2}|}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle |PF_{1}|,\ |PF_{2}|}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/11f9cd6112506b260df20f12b6c45035dee7692d" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:12.79ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        to two fixed points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle F_{1}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="F_{1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/100c7fbf174fe8b06eacc2a6b0bb2e1badd1c7ce" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.549ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        ,
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle F_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="F_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0fd17e0779153d765b40ebef91533489b87b2e37" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.549ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        , the
        <b>
         foci
        </b>
        , is constant, usually denoted by
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle 2a,\ a&gt;0\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mn>
               2
              </mn>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               &gt;
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle 2a,\ a&gt;0\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle 2a,\ a&gt;0\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/257cf051300e94e81b5edc1ae73496313b513db3" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:10.725ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        In order to omit the special case of a line segment, one presumes
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle 2a&gt;|F_{1}F_{2}|\ :}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mn>
               2
              </mn>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               &gt;
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               :
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle 2a&gt;|F_{1}F_{2}|\ :}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle 2a&gt;|F_{1}F_{2}|\ :}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/db023afbbfdbab64a9f7c3f9ad722423b0b046bf" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:13.755ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle E=\{P\mid |PF_{2}|+|PF_{1}|=2a\}\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               E
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">
               {
              </mo>
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ∣
               <!-- ∣ -->
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               2
              </mn>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">
               }
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle E=\{P\mid |PF_{2}|+|PF_{1}|=2a\}\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle E=\{P\mid |PF_{2}|+|PF_{1}|=2a\}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b11f9cbacebc3d4923fc873fc6bff8e12ec5e494" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:31.616ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The midpoint
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle C}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              C
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle C}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="C" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4fc55753007cd3c18576f7933f6f089196732029" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.766ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       of the line segment joining the foci is called the
       <b>
        center
       </b>
       of the ellipse. The line through the foci is called the
       <b>
        major axis
       </b>
       , and the line perpendicular to it through the center is called the
       <b>
        minor axis
       </b>
       . It contains the
       <b>
        vertices
       </b>
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/50193d5201b7ff4d46487f5d5e58ee9c1e6f29fc" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.853ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       , which have distance
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="a" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ffd2487510aa438433a2579450ab2b3d557e5edc" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.23ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       to the center. The distance
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle c}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              c
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle c}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="c" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/86a67b81c2de995bd608d5b2df50cd8cd7d92455" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.007ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       of the foci to the center is called the
       <b>
        focal distance
       </b>
       or
       <b>
        linear eccentricity
       </b>
       . The quotient
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {c}{a}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <mi>
                 c
                </mi>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\tfrac {c}{a}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {c}{a}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/1844bde80caf4f48b9cb88d76abf300843f53cc3" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:1.706ex; height:3.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       is the
       <b>
        eccentricity
       </b>
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle e}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              e
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle e}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="e" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/cd253103f0876afc68ebead27a5aa9867d927467" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.083ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       The case
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{1}=F_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               F
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               F
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle F_{1}=F_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle F_{1}=F_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4a1387d67417e45de53b554e8b775be7ad3cb236" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:8.196ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       yields a circle and is included.
      </p>
      <p>
       The equation
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle |PF_{2}|+|PF_{1}|=2a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               |
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mi>
              P
             </mi>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               F
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               |
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               |
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mi>
              P
             </mi>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               F
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               |
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle |PF_{2}|+|PF_{1}|=2a}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle |PF_{2}|+|PF_{1}|=2a}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/55ce5f9418f1280f8145047acfb06beadf72b81f" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:19.507ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       can be viewed in a different way (see picture):
       <br/>
       If
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle c_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle c_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="c_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0b30ba1b247fb8d334580cec68561e749d24aff2" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.061ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       is the circle with midpoint
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               F
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle F_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="F_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0fd17e0779153d765b40ebef91533489b87b2e37" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.549ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       and radius
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle 2a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle 2a}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="2a" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/d325c24be7d760207674a169b078892bdd5cbc76" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.392ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       , then the distance of a point
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle P}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              P
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle P}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="P" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b4dc73bf40314945ff376bd363916a738548d40a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.745ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       to the circle
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle c_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle c_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="c_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0b30ba1b247fb8d334580cec68561e749d24aff2" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.061ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       equals the distance to the focus
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               F
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle F_{1}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="F_{1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/100c7fbf174fe8b06eacc2a6b0bb2e1badd1c7ce" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.549ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       :
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <dl>
         <dd>
          <span class="mwe-math-element">
           <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
            <math alttext="{\displaystyle |PF_{1}|=|Pc_{2}|.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
             <semantics>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  |
                 </mo>
                </mrow>
                <mi>
                 P
                </mi>
                <msub>
                 <mi>
                  F
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   1
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msub>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  |
                 </mo>
                </mrow>
                <mo>
                 =
                </mo>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  |
                 </mo>
                </mrow>
                <mi>
                 P
                </mi>
                <msub>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msub>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  |
                 </mo>
                </mrow>
                <mo>
                 .
                </mo>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
               {\displaystyle |PF_{1}|=|Pc_{2}|.}
              </annotation>
             </semantics>
            </math>
           </span>
           <img alt="{\displaystyle |PF_{1}|=|Pc_{2}|.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/318482c4ed5d4d615ed418ed6affd96878a64c2b" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:14.433ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
          </span>
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle c_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle c_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="c_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0b30ba1b247fb8d334580cec68561e749d24aff2" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.061ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       is called the
       <b>
        circular directrix
       </b>
       (related to focus
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               F
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle F_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="F_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0fd17e0779153d765b40ebef91533489b87b2e37" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.549ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       ) of the ellipse.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-1">
         [1]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-2">
         [2]
        </a>
       </sup>
       This property should not be confused with the definition of an ellipse with help of a directrix (line) below.
      </p>
      <p>
       Using
       <a href="/wiki/Dandelin_spheres" title="Dandelin spheres">
        Dandelin spheres
       </a>
       one proves easily the important statement:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Any
        <i>
         plane section of a cone
        </i>
        with a plane, which does not contain the apex and whose slope is less than the slope of the lines on the cone, is an ellipse.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Ellipse_in_Cartesian_coordinates">
        Ellipse in Cartesian coordinates
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Ellipse in Cartesian coordinates">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-param.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="229" data-file-width="296" height="170" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Ellipse-param.svg/220px-Ellipse-param.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Ellipse-param.svg/330px-Ellipse-param.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4d/Ellipse-param.svg/440px-Ellipse-param.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-param.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         shape parameters:
         <br/>
         a: semi-major axis,
         <br/>
         b: semi-minor axis
         <br/>
         c: linear eccentricity,
         <br/>
         p: semi-latus rectum.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Equation">
        Equation
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Equation">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       If Cartesian coordinates are introduced such that the origin is the center of the ellipse and the
       <i>
        x
       </i>
       -axis is the major axis and
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        the
        <i>
         foci
        </i>
        are the points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{1}=(c,0),\ F_{2}=(-c,0)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle F_{1}=(c,0),\ F_{2}=(-c,0)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle F_{1}=(c,0),\ F_{2}=(-c,0)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/83f70459b5c03c313c63cd348a80822e447e0ff9" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:24.742ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        ,
       </dd>
       <dd>
        the
        <i>
         vertices
        </i>
        are
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1}=(a,0),\ V_{2}=(-a,0)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle V_{1}=(a,0),\ V_{2}=(-a,0)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1}=(a,0),\ V_{2}=(-a,0)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4b7015361ccc9e2844d5d8bad1772f50dd1c8d33" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:24.91ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        .
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       For an arbitrary point
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (x,y)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              x
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              y
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (x,y)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="(x,y)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/41cf50e4a314ca8e2c30964baa8d26e5be7a9386" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:5.328ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       the distance to the focus
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (c,0)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              c
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (c,0)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="(c,0)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/fde1d2813d28b59afd35f5e3eb2261f647fa8556" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:5.013ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       is
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x-c)^{2}+y^{2}}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <msqrt>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                (
               </mo>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mo>
                −
                <!-- − -->
               </mo>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <msup>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 )
                </mo>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
               <mo>
                +
               </mo>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 y
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </msqrt>
             </mrow>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x-c)^{2}+y^{2}}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x-c)^{2}+y^{2}}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/8f271fd9d6d22f31d08e15e66fa3040ec8966725" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:15.419ex; height:4.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       and to the second focus
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x+c)^{2}+y^{2}}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <msqrt>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                (
               </mo>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mo>
                +
               </mo>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <msup>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 )
                </mo>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
               <mo>
                +
               </mo>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 y
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </msqrt>
             </mrow>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x+c)^{2}+y^{2}}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x+c)^{2}+y^{2}}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/90d277874a3ca2f70c92e6073b0393d3cd420d1c" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:15.419ex; height:4.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       . Hence the point
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (x,y)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              x
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              y
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (x,y)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="(x,y)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/41cf50e4a314ca8e2c30964baa8d26e5be7a9386" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:5.328ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       is on the ellipse if the following condition is fulfilled
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x-c)^{2}+y^{2}}}+{\sqrt {(x+c)^{2}+y^{2}}}=2a\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <msqrt>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 (
                </mo>
                <mi>
                 x
                </mi>
                <mo>
                 −
                 <!-- − -->
                </mo>
                <mi>
                 c
                </mi>
                <msup>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  )
                 </mo>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <mo>
                 +
                </mo>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </msqrt>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <msqrt>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 (
                </mo>
                <mi>
                 x
                </mi>
                <mo>
                 +
                </mo>
                <mi>
                 c
                </mi>
                <msup>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  )
                 </mo>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <mo>
                 +
                </mo>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </msqrt>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               2
              </mn>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x-c)^{2}+y^{2}}}+{\sqrt {(x+c)^{2}+y^{2}}}=2a\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\sqrt {(x-c)^{2}+y^{2}}}+{\sqrt {(x+c)^{2}+y^{2}}}=2a\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e15f97cb735b9a82d625eeaadefff259768024d8" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:40.397ex; height:4.843ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       Remove the square roots by suitable squarings and use the relation
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle b^{2}=a^{2}-c^{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msup>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle b^{2}=a^{2}-c^{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle b^{2}=a^{2}-c^{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/de9c4159f7452d258ea1f437cbf4f42d1d01ed1f" style="vertical-align: -0.505ex; width:12.336ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       to obtain the equation of the ellipse:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               1
              </mn>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\frac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/3d7eb067b1ac196e718e5003ed60a0ea37577483" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:13.372ex; height:6.009ex;"/>
        </span>
        or solved for y
       </li>
      </ul>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle y=\pm {\frac {b}{a}}{\sqrt {a^{2}-x^{2}}}.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ±
               <!-- ± -->
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mi>
                 b
                </mi>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <msqrt>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <mo>
                 −
                 <!-- − -->
                </mo>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </msqrt>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle y=\pm {\frac {b}{a}}{\sqrt {a^{2}-x^{2}}}.}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle y=\pm {\frac {b}{a}}{\sqrt {a^{2}-x^{2}}}.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/6a80d4dc64e83032ed47ebc093abc0cead9d47c2" style="vertical-align: -1.838ex; width:18.607ex; height:5.343ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The shape parameters
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a,\;b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a,\;b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle a,\;b}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/1c747ea5fdf635321385220fd12675e9c1257a02" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:3.906ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       are called the
       <a href="/wiki/Semi-major_and_semi-minor_axes" title="Semi-major and semi-minor axes">
        semi-major and semi-minor axes
       </a>
       . The points
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{3}=(0,b),\;V_{4}=(0,-b)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                3
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                4
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{3}=(0,b),\;V_{4}=(0,-b)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{3}=(0,b),\;V_{4}=(0,-b)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/a8762aeb7fb5d29ced4e9ae1381f7fb0fc8b7af2" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:24.51ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       are the
       <b>
        co-vertices
       </b>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       It follows from the equation that the ellipse is
       <i>
        symmetric
       </i>
       with respect to both of the coordinate axes and hence symmetric with respect to the origin.
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Semi-latus_rectum">
        Semi-latus rectum
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Semi-latus rectum">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       The length of the chord through one of the foci, which is perpendicular to the major axis of the ellipse is called the
       <b>
        latus rectum
       </b>
       . One half of it is the
       <b>
        semi-latus rectum
       </b>
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle p}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              p
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle p}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="p" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/81eac1e205430d1f40810df36a0edffdc367af36" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; margin-left: -0.089ex; width:1.259ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       . A calculation shows
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle p={\frac {b^{2}}{a}}.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               p
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle p={\frac {b^{2}}{a}}.}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle p={\frac {b^{2}}{a}}.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4666011d678a26069261a7b5ee4951671d22e721" style="vertical-align: -1.838ex; margin-left: -0.089ex; width:7.892ex; height:5.676ex;"/>
        </span>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The semi-latus rectum
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle p}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              p
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle p}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="p" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/81eac1e205430d1f40810df36a0edffdc367af36" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; margin-left: -0.089ex; width:1.259ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       may also be viewed as the
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Radius_of_curvature" title="Radius of curvature">
         radius of curvature
        </a>
       </i>
       of the
       <a href="/wiki/Osculating_circle" title="Osculating circle">
        osculating circles
       </a>
       at the vertices
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (\pm a,0)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ±
              <!-- ± -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (\pm a,0)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="(\pm a,0)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/58f43d4d49576077a52ce7939e40b34e831b5fa5" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:7.044ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Tangent">
        Tangent
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Tangent">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
