                    </mn>
                   </mrow>
                  </msub>
                 </mrow>
                </mfrac>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle \cot(2t_{0})={\tfrac {{\vec {f}}_{1}^{\,2}-{\vec {f}}_{2}^{\,2}}{2{\vec {f}}_{1}\cdot {\vec {f}}_{2}}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle \cot(2t_{0})={\tfrac {{\vec {f}}_{1}^{\,2}-{\vec {f}}_{2}^{\,2}}{2{\vec {f}}_{1}\cdot {\vec {f}}_{2}}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/a2de117e9eaccca5ad4395157b333e01d9cd7f07" style="vertical-align: -2.338ex; width:18.197ex; height:6.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        .
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       (The formulae
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \cos ^{2}t-\sin ^{2}t=\cos 2t,\ 2\sin t\cos t=\sin 2t}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msup>
              <mi>
               cos
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               sin
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mi>
              cos
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mtext>
             </mtext>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              sin
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mi>
              cos
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mi>
              sin
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \cos ^{2}t-\sin ^{2}t=\cos 2t,\ 2\sin t\cos t=\sin 2t}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle \cos ^{2}t-\sin ^{2}t=\cos 2t,\ 2\sin t\cos t=\sin 2t}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/095d40f6b03bced601f12210b0197f0aa8c1e5f9" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:42.282ex; height:3.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       were used.)
      </p>
      <p>
       If
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {f}}_{1}\cdot {\vec {f}}_{2}=0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  f
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ⋅
              <!-- ⋅ -->
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  f
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {f}}_{1}\cdot {\vec {f}}_{2}=0}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {f}}_{1}\cdot {\vec {f}}_{2}=0}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/627e8b67be7146b9f5511aa81551afbec6323796" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:11.378ex; height:3.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       , then
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle t_{0}=0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle t_{0}=0}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="t_{0}=0" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/129dee73708133aabd89cd4adf5f38ebcaf23a86" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:6.155ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       The
       <b>
        4 vertices
       </b>
       of the ellipse are
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t_{0}),\;{\vec {p}}(t_{0}\pm {\frac {\pi }{2}}),\;{\vec {p}}(t_{0}+\pi )\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ±
              <!-- ± -->
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mfrac>
               <mi>
                π
                <!-- π -->
               </mi>
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mfrac>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mtext>
             </mtext>
             <mo>
              .
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t_{0}),\;{\vec {p}}(t_{0}\pm {\frac {\pi }{2}}),\;{\vec {p}}(t_{0}+\pi )\ .}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t_{0}),\;{\vec {p}}(t_{0}\pm {\frac {\pi }{2}}),\;{\vec {p}}(t_{0}+\pi )\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/926b7c5b244e76357c8295d0db60746c9f4a9002" style="vertical-align: -1.838ex; margin-left: -0.089ex; width:28.941ex; height:4.676ex;"/>
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       The advantage of this definition is that one gets a simple parametric representation of an arbitrary ellipse, even in the space, if the vectors
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {f}}_{0},{\vec {f}}_{1},{\vec {f}}_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  f
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  f
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  f
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {f}}_{0},{\vec {f}}_{1},{\vec {f}}_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {f}}_{0},{\vec {f}}_{1},{\vec {f}}_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0583853158e69e51d160d215326363e456e6b23a" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:10.225ex; height:3.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       are vectors of the Euclidean space.
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Conjugate_diameters_and_the_midpoints_of_parallel_chords">
        Conjugate diameters and the midpoints of parallel chords
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Conjugate diameters and the midpoints of parallel chords">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:402px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="153" data-file-width="501" height="122" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg/400px-Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg/600px-Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg/800px-Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg.png 2x" width="400"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Parallelproj-kreis-ellipse.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Orthogonal diameters of a circle with a square of tangents, midpoints of parallel chords and an affine image, which is an ellipse with conjugate diameters, a parallelogram of tangents and midpoints of chords
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       For a circle, obviously
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <b>
         (M)
        </b>
        the midpoints of parallel chords lie on a diameter.
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The diameter and the parallel chords are orthogonal. An affine transformation in general does not preserve orthogonality but does preserve parallelism and midpoints of line segments. Hence: property
       <b>
        (M)
       </b>
       (which omits the term
       <i>
        orthogonal
       </i>
       ) is true for any ellipse.
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dt>
        Definition
       </dt>
      </dl>
      <p>
       Two diameters
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle d_{1},\;d_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle d_{1},\;d_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle d_{1},\;d_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/6fd277c42d7965f4745ef4ac6b490999d2fdb7e8" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:6.205ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       of an ellipse are
       <b>
        conjugate
       </b>
       if the midpoints of chords parallel to
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle d_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle d_{1}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="d_{1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4cccb5a6a2f1acab4ca255e0be86c224ed82282a" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.263ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       lie on
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle d_{2}\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mtext>
             </mtext>
             <mo>
              .
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle d_{2}\ .}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle d_{2}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/c137866b85a6b691fcfce4806943dc362bd9a889" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:3.491ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       From the diagram one finds:
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <b>
         (T)
        </b>
        Two diameters
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle d_{1}:{\overline {P_{1}Q_{1}}}\;,\;d_{2}:{\overline {P_{2}Q_{2}}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                d
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               :
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mrow>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   P
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    1
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   Q
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    1
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                </mrow>
                <mo accent="false">
                 ¯
                 <!-- ¯ -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
              <mspace width="thickmathspace">
              </mspace>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mspace width="thickmathspace">
              </mspace>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                d
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               :
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mrow>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   P
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   Q
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                </mrow>
                <mo accent="false">
                 ¯
                 <!-- ¯ -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle d_{1}:{\overline {P_{1}Q_{1}}}\;,\;d_{2}:{\overline {P_{2}Q_{2}}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle d_{1}:{\overline {P_{1}Q_{1}}}\;,\;d_{2}:{\overline {P_{2}Q_{2}}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/3638e8de3e208daefcff2a114d081594f038e865" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:21.833ex; height:3.343ex;"/>
        </span>
        , of an ellipse are
        <i>
         conjugate
        </i>
        , if the tangents at
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{1}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{1}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/398f438d75434e6fbf48dc232c1ad7228a738568" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.547ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle Q_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                Q
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle Q_{1}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="Q_{1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/a8ea6463cb36d8278ff71214fb4d13127039ae53" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.893ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        are parallel to
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle d_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                d
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle d_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="d_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9276f8f68c5c23329de74ad76e69f6801358fb1f" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.263ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        and visa versa.
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The term
       <i>
        conjugate diameters
       </i>
       is a kind of generalization of
       <i>
        orthogonal
       </i>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       Considering the
       <a href="/wiki/Parametric_equation" title="Parametric equation">
        parametric equation
       </a>
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {x}}={\vec {p}}(t)={\vec {f}}_{0}+{\vec {f}}_{1}\cos t+{\vec {f}}_{2}\sin t}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  p
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mover>
                  <mi>
                   f
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   →
                   <!-- → -->
                  </mo>
                 </mover>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 0
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mover>
                  <mi>
                   f
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   →
                   <!-- → -->
                  </mo>
                 </mover>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mi>
               cos
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ⁡
               <!-- ⁡ -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mover>
                  <mi>
                   f
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   →
                   <!-- → -->
                  </mo>
                 </mover>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mi>
               sin
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ⁡
               <!-- ⁡ -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\vec {x}}={\vec {p}}(t)={\vec {f}}_{0}+{\vec {f}}_{1}\cos t+{\vec {f}}_{2}\sin t}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {x}}={\vec {p}}(t)={\vec {f}}_{0}+{\vec {f}}_{1}\cos t+{\vec {f}}_{2}\sin t}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/92fa9db0ad83c450d043b3ac287dc7e1e17a035e" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:34.533ex; height:3.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       of an ellipse, any pair
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t),{\vec {p}}(t+\pi )}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t),{\vec {p}}(t+\pi )}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t),{\vec {p}}(t+\pi )}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/11152ac4088ffcae5bce6a6941ae1dcb81466eec" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; margin-left: -0.089ex; width:13.244ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       of points belong to a diameter and the pair
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t+\pi /2),{\vec {p}}(t-\pi /2)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo>
               /
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo>
               /
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t+\pi /2),{\vec {p}}(t-\pi /2)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t+\pi /2),{\vec {p}}(t-\pi /2)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/dc5a03253c4f6f8603da6f8449dcad4d29b7a7b7" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; margin-left: -0.089ex; width:22.066ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       belongs to its conjugate diameter.
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Orthogonal_tangents">
        Orthogonal tangents
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Orthogonal tangents">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="252" data-file-width="279" height="199" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4b/Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg/220px-Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4b/Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg/330px-Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4b/Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg/440px-Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Orthoptic-ellipse-s.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse with its orthoptic
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Orthoptic_(geometry)" title="Orthoptic (geometry)">
        Orthoptic (geometry)
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       For the ellipse
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f6aa55c90da259c96a7894fe6e7555d2428cdec3" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:12.198ex; height:4.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       the intersection points of
       <i>
        orthogonal
       </i>
       tangents lie on the circle
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle x^{2}+y^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msup>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle x^{2}+y^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="x^{2}+y^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/6dd31878083e5f3d3002eb9c7e1601f0b8ed698b" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:17.714ex; height:3.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       This circle is called
       <i>
        orthoptic
       </i>
       of the given ellipse.
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Theorem_of_Apollonios_on_conjugate_diameters">
        Theorem of Apollonios on conjugate diameters
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Theorem of Apollonios on conjugate diameters">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Elli-apoll-cd.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="278" data-file-width="296" height="282" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Elli-apoll-cd.svg/300px-Elli-apoll-cd.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Elli-apoll-cd.svg/450px-Elli-apoll-cd.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/Elli-apoll-cd.svg/600px-Elli-apoll-cd.svg.png 2x" width="300"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Elli-apoll-cd.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: theorem of Apollonios on conjugate diameters
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       For an ellipse with semi-axes
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a,\;b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a,\;b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle a,\;b}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/1c747ea5fdf635321385220fd12675e9c1257a02" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:3.906ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       the following is true:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Let
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle c_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle c_{1}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle c_{1}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/77b7dc6d279091d354e0b90889b463bfa7eb7247" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.061ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle c_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle c_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle c_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0b30ba1b247fb8d334580cec68561e749d24aff2" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.061ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
        </span>
        be halves of two conjugate diameters (see diagram) then
       </li>
      </ul>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <b>
         (1)
        </b>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle c_{1}^{2}+c_{2}^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msubsup>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msubsup>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msubsup>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msubsup>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                a
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                b
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle c_{1}^{2}+c_{2}^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle c_{1}^{2}+c_{2}^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f8027389bd601427c47af3173b2cbae03bbee9da" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:17.237ex; height:3.343ex;"/>
        </span>
        ,
       </dd>
       <dd>
        <b>
         (2)
        </b>
        the
        <i>
         triangle
        </i>
        formed by
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle c_{1},\;c_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mspace width="thickmathspace">
              </mspace>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                c
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle c_{1},\;c_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle c_{1},\;c_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/c18d4acf5a1894679dc8fe3e7fd26823fcab4374" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.801ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
        </span>
        has the constant area
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle A_{\Delta }={\frac {1}{2}}ab}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                A
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi mathvariant="normal">
                 Δ
                 <!-- Δ -->
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle A_{\Delta }={\frac {1}{2}}ab}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle A_{\Delta }={\frac {1}{2}}ab}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/bb909d40de526ecd00984c165d198317289007b8" style="vertical-align: -1.838ex; width:10.669ex; height:5.176ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
       <dd>
        <b>
         (3)
        </b>
        the parallelogram of tangents adjacent to the given conjugate diameters has the
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\text{Area}}_{12}=4ab\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mtext>
                 Area
                </mtext>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 12
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               4
              </mn>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\text{Area}}_{12}=4ab\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\text{Area}}_{12}=4ab\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/5930b4f3831586188b40422fdb0d07e321a785de" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:14.442ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
       <dt>
        Proof
       </dt>
      </dl>
      <p>
       Let the ellipse be in the canonical form with parametric equation
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t)=(a\cos t,b\sin t)^{T}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  p
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               cos
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ⁡
               <!-- ⁡ -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mi>
               sin
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ⁡
               <!-- ⁡ -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                )
               </mo>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 T
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t)=(a\cos t,b\sin t)^{T}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {p}}(t)=(a\cos t,b\sin t)^{T}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/fc9aaf4034ede56853f3b45170b7add31e46a57d" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; margin-left: -0.089ex; width:22.816ex; height:3.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        .
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The two points
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{1}={\vec {p}}(t),\ {\vec {c}}_{2}={\vec {p}}(t+\pi /2)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mtext>
             </mtext>
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mover>
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 →
                 <!-- → -->
                </mo>
               </mover>
              </mrow>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo>
               /
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{1}={\vec {p}}(t),\ {\vec {c}}_{2}={\vec {p}}(t+\pi /2)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{1}={\vec {p}}(t),\ {\vec {c}}_{2}={\vec {p}}(t+\pi /2)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7357172cbfd6685b5cbcbba2d66afae8b6ae6783" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:26.812ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       are on conjugate diameters (see previous section). From trigonometric formulae one gets
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{2}=(-a\sin t,b\cos t)^{T}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mi>
              sin
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mi>
              cos
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi>
                T
               </mi>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{2}=(-a\sin t,b\cos t)^{T}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{2}=(-a\sin t,b\cos t)^{T}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/760a2d6ed50fbcd24a669f487f76d2dbe4ef6be8" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:22.838ex; height:3.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       and
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle |{\vec {c}}_{1}|^{2}+|{\vec {c}}_{2}|^{2}=\cdots =a^{2}+b^{2}\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">

                   →
                   <!-- → -->
                  </mo>
                 </mover>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">

                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>

               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">

               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>

               </mrow>

              <mo>

              </mo>

               <mo stretchy="false">
                |
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mover>
                  <mi>
                   c
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   →
                   <!-- → -->
                  </mo>
                 </mover>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <msup>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mo stretchy="false">
                 |
                </mo>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ⋯
               <!-- ⋯ -->
              </mo>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                a
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                b
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle |{\vec {c}}_{1}|^{2}+|{\vec {c}}_{2}|^{2}=\cdots =a^{2}+b^{2}\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle |{\vec {c}}_{1}|^{2}+|{\vec {c}}_{2}|^{2}=\cdots =a^{2}+b^{2}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/01c94e68b9cdb47298063a5b8bb00de1310b22bb" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:29.415ex; height:3.343ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The area of the triangle generated by
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{1},{\vec {c}}_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mover>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  →
                  <!-- → -->
                 </mo>
                </mover>
               </mrow>
              </mrow>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{1},{\vec {c}}_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\vec {c}}_{1},{\vec {c}}_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9e0d243b3205edf0f38d739a2fc4346d184e1409" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.589ex; height:2.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       is
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle A_{\Delta }={\tfrac {1}{2}}\det({\vec {c}}_{1},{\vec {c}}_{2})=\cdots ={\tfrac {1}{2}}ab}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                A
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi mathvariant="normal">
                 Δ
                 <!-- Δ -->
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
                <mfrac>
                 <mn>
                  1
                 </mn>
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mfrac>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <mo form="prefix" movablelimits="true">
               det
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mover>
                  <mi>
                   c
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   →
                   <!-- → -->
                  </mo>
                 </mover>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mover>
                  <mi>
                   c
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   →
                   <!-- → -->
                  </mo>
                 </mover>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ⋯
               <!-- ⋯ -->
              </mo>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
                <mfrac>
                 <mn>
                  1
                 </mn>
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mfrac>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle A_{\Delta }={\tfrac {1}{2}}\det({\vec {c}}_{1},{\vec {c}}_{2})=\cdots ={\tfrac {1}{2}}ab}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle A_{\Delta }={\tfrac {1}{2}}\det({\vec {c}}_{1},{\vec {c}}_{2})=\cdots ={\tfrac {1}{2}}ab}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/fbaec504d178fa3f81c819921c8b2c3c92db781d" style="vertical-align: -1.171ex; width:31.921ex; height:3.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       and from the diagram it can be seen that the area of the parallelogram is 8 times that of
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle A_{\Delta }}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               A
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi mathvariant="normal">
                Δ
                <!-- Δ -->
               </mi>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle A_{\Delta }}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle A_{\Delta }}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e84235d4f07db280c797a2771ff5f806b1bb5404" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:3.344ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       . Hence
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\text{Area}}_{12}=4ab\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mtext>
                 Area
                </mtext>
               </mrow>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 12
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               4
              </mn>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\text{Area}}_{12}=4ab\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\text{Area}}_{12}=4ab\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/5930b4f3831586188b40422fdb0d07e321a785de" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:14.442ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Drawing_ellipses">
        Drawing ellipses
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: Drawing ellipses">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Zp-turm-tor.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="417" data-file-width="505" height="182" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/Zp-turm-tor.svg/220px-Zp-turm-tor.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/Zp-turm-tor.svg/330px-Zp-turm-tor.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c2/Zp-turm-tor.svg/440px-Zp-turm-tor.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Zp-turm-tor.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Central projection of circles (gate)
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Ellipses appear in
       <a href="/wiki/Descriptive_geometry" title="Descriptive geometry">
        descriptive geometry
       </a>
       as images (parallel or central projection) of circles (for details: see
       <a class="extiw" href="https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellipse_(Darstellende_Geometrie)" title="de:Ellipse (Darstellende Geometrie)">
        Ellipses in DG (German)
       </a>
       ). So it is essential to have tools to draw an ellipse. Nowadays the best tool is the computer. During the times before this tool was not available and one was restricted to compass and ruler for the construction of single points of an ellipse. But there are technical tools (
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Ellipse#ellipsographs" title="Ellipse">
         ellipsographs
        </a>
       </i>
       ) to draw an ellipse in a continuous way like a compass for drawing a circle, too. The principle of ellipsographs were known to Greek mathematicians (
       <a href="/wiki/Archimedes" title="Archimedes">
        Archimedes
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Proklos" title="Proklos">
        Proklos
       </a>
       ) already.
      </p>
      <p>
       If there is no ellipsograph available, the best and quickest way to draw an ellipse is to draw an
       <a href="/wiki/Ellipse#Approximation_by_osculating_circles" title="Ellipse">
        Approximation by the four osculating circles at the vertices
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       For any method described below
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        the knowledge of the axes and the semi-axes is necessary (or equivalent: the foci and the semi-major axis).
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       If this presumption is not fulfilled one has to know at least two conjugate diameters. With help of
       <a href="/wiki/Rytz%27s_construction" title="Rytz's construction">
        Rytz's construction
       </a>
