       the axes and semi-axes can be retrieved.
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Elliko-g.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="246" data-file-width="296" height="208" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e4/Elliko-g.svg/250px-Elliko-g.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e4/Elliko-g.svg/375px-Elliko-g.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e4/Elliko-g.svg/500px-Elliko-g.svg.png 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Elliko-g.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: gardener's method
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Pins-and-string_method">
        Pins-and-string method
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Pins-and-string method">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       The characterization of an ellipse as the locus of points so that sum of the distances to the foci is constant leads to a method of drawing one using two
       <a href="/wiki/Drawing_pin" title="Drawing pin">
        drawing pins
       </a>
       , a length of string, and a pencil. In this method, pins are pushed into the paper at two points, which become the ellipse's foci. A string tied at each end to the two pins and the tip of a pencil pulls the loop taut to form a
       <a href="/wiki/Triangle" title="Triangle">
        triangle
       </a>
       . The tip of the pencil then traces an ellipse if it is moved while keeping the string taut. Using two pegs and a rope, gardeners use this procedure to outline an elliptical flower bed—thus it is called the
       <i>
        gardener's ellipse
       </i>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       A similar method for drawing
       <a href="/wiki/Confocal_conic_sections#Graves's_theorem:_the_construction_of_confocal_ellipses_by_a_string" title="Confocal conic sections">
        confocal ellipses
       </a>
       with a
       <i>
        closed
       </i>
       string is due to the Irish bishop
       <a href="/wiki/Charles_Graves_(bishop)" title="Charles Graves (bishop)">
        Charles Graves
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Paper_strip_methods">
        Paper strip methods
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: Paper strip methods">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       The two following methods rely on the parametric representation (see section
       <i>
        parametric representation
       </i>
       , above):
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               cos
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ⁡
               <!-- ⁡ -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mspace width="thickmathspace">
              </mspace>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mi>
               sin
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ⁡
               <!-- ⁡ -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               t
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e85101db8ea3d062abd7dfc53f14f5b09c268ed7" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:14.91ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       This representation can be modeled technically by two simple methods. In both cases center, the axes and semi axes
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a,\;b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a,\;b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle a,\;b}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/1c747ea5fdf635321385220fd12675e9c1257a02" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:3.906ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       have to be known.
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dt>
        Method 1
       </dt>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The first method starts with
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        a strip of paper of length
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle a+b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle a+b}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="a+b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/a2391acf09244b9dba74eb940e871a6be7e7973a" style="vertical-align: -0.505ex; width:5.068ex; height:2.343ex;"/>
        </span>
        .
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The point, where the semi axes meet is marked by
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle P}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              P
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle P}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="P" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b4dc73bf40314945ff376bd363916a738548d40a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.745ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       . If the strip slides with both ends on the axes of the desired ellipse, then point P traces the ellipse. For the proof one shows that point
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle P}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              P
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle P}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="P" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b4dc73bf40314945ff376bd363916a738548d40a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.745ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       has the parametric representation
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mi>
              cos
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mi>
              sin
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e85101db8ea3d062abd7dfc53f14f5b09c268ed7" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:14.91ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       , where parameter
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle t}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle t}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="t" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/65658b7b223af9e1acc877d848888ecdb4466560" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.84ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       is the angle of the slope of the paper strip.
      </p>
      <p>
       A
       <i>
        technichal realization
       </i>
       of the motion of the paper strip can be achieved by a
       <a href="/wiki/Tusi_couple" title="Tusi couple">
        Tusi couple
       </a>
       (s. animation). The device is able to draw any ellipse with a
       <i>
        fixed
       </i>
       sum
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a+b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a+b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="a+b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/a2391acf09244b9dba74eb940e871a6be7e7973a" style="vertical-align: -0.505ex; width:5.068ex; height:2.343ex;"/>
       </span>
       , which is the radius of the large circle. This restriction may be a disadvantage in real life. More flexible is the second paper strip method.
      </p>
      <p>
       A nice application: If one stands somewhere in the middle of a ladder, which stands on a slippery ground and leans on a slippery wall, the ladder slides down and the persons feet trace an ellipse.
      </p>
      <ul class='gallery mw-gallery-traditional "float-left'>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 285px">
        <div style="width: 285px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 280px;">
          <div style="margin:60px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Elliko-pap1.svg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="189" data-file-width="296" height="160" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Elliko-pap1.svg/250px-Elliko-pap1.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Elliko-pap1.svg/375px-Elliko-pap1.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Elliko-pap1.svg/500px-Elliko-pap1.svg.png 2x" width="250"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           Ellipse construction: paper strip method 1
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 285px">
        <div style="width: 285px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 280px;">
          <div style="margin:15px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Tusi_couple_vs_Paper_strip_plus_Ellipses_horizontal.gif">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="500" data-file-width="500" height="250" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Tusi_couple_vs_Paper_strip_plus_Ellipses_horizontal.gif/250px-Tusi_couple_vs_Paper_strip_plus_Ellipses_horizontal.gif" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Tusi_couple_vs_Paper_strip_plus_Ellipses_horizontal.gif/375px-Tusi_couple_vs_Paper_strip_plus_Ellipses_horizontal.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ea/Tusi_couple_vs_Paper_strip_plus_Ellipses_horizontal.gif 2x" width="250"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           Ellipses with Tusi couple. Two examples: red and cyan.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       A
       <i>
        variation of the paper strip method 1
       </i>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4">
        <a href="#cite_note-4">
         [4]
        </a>
       </sup>
       uses the observation, that the midpoint
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle N}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              N
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle N}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="N" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f5e3890c981ae85503089652feb48b191b57aae3" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.064ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       of the paper strip is moving on the circle with center
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle M}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              M
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle M}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="M" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f82cade9898ced02fdd08712e5f0c0151758a0dd" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.442ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       (of the ellipse) and radius
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {a+b}{2}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  +
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                </mrow>
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\tfrac {a+b}{2}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {a+b}{2}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/cdc7810f36b1298823a923ee35d6cd0abe79d122" style="vertical-align: -1.171ex; width:3.69ex; height:3.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       . Hence the paperstrip can be cut at point
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle N}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              N
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle N}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="N" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f5e3890c981ae85503089652feb48b191b57aae3" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.064ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       into halves, connected again by a joint at
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle N}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              N
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle N}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="N" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f5e3890c981ae85503089652feb48b191b57aae3" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.064ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       and the sliding end
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle K}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              K
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle K}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="K" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/2b76fce82a62ed5461908f0dc8f037de4e3686b0" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.066ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       fixed at the center
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle M}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              M
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle M}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="M" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f82cade9898ced02fdd08712e5f0c0151758a0dd" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.442ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       (see diagram). After this operation the movement of the unchanged half of the paperstrip is unchanged. The advantage of this variation is: Only one expensive sliding shoe is necessary.
       <br/>
       One should be aware that the end, which is sliding on the minor axis, has to be changed.
      </p>
      <ul class='gallery mw-gallery-traditional "float-left'>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 335px">
        <div style="width: 335px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 330px;">
          <div style="margin:15px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-papsm-1a.svg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="202" data-file-width="296" height="200" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Ellipse-papsm-1a.svg/293px-Ellipse-papsm-1a.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Ellipse-papsm-1a.svg/440px-Ellipse-papsm-1a.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/be/Ellipse-papsm-1a.svg/586px-Ellipse-papsm-1a.svg.png 2x" width="293"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           Variation of the paper strip method 1
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 335px">
        <div style="width: 335px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 330px;">
          <div style="margin:40px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_inner_Ellipses.gif">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="325" data-file-width="650" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_inner_Ellipses.gif/300px-Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_inner_Ellipses.gif" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_inner_Ellipses.gif/450px-Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_inner_Ellipses.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_inner_Ellipses.gif/600px-Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_inner_Ellipses.gif 2x" width="300"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           Animation of the variation of the paper strip method 1
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Elliko-pap2.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="193" data-file-width="249" height="194" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Elliko-pap2.svg/250px-Elliko-pap2.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Elliko-pap2.svg/375px-Elliko-pap2.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Elliko-pap2.svg/500px-Elliko-pap2.svg.png 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Elliko-pap2.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse construction: paper strip method 2
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <dl>
       <dt>
        Method 2
       </dt>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The second method starts with
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        a strip of paper of length
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle a}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="a" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ffd2487510aa438433a2579450ab2b3d557e5edc" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.23ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
        </span>
        .
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       One marks the point, which divides the strip into two substrips of length
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f11423fbb2e967f986e36804a8ae4271734917c3" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.998ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       and
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a-b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a-b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="a-b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/1b80866c2bf2f1bc1f2e4c97e7937f5663150ea6" style="vertical-align: -0.505ex; width:5.068ex; height:2.343ex;"/>
       </span>
       . The strip is positioned onto the axes as described in the diagram. Then the free end of the strip traces an ellipse, while the strip is moved. For the proof, one recognizes that the tracing point can be described parametrically by
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mi>
              cos
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mi>
              sin
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ⁡
              <!-- ⁡ -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle (a\cos t,\;b\sin t)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e85101db8ea3d062abd7dfc53f14f5b09c268ed7" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:14.91ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       , where parameter
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle t}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              t
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle t}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="t" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/65658b7b223af9e1acc877d848888ecdb4466560" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.84ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       is the angle of slope of the paper strip.
      </p>
      <p>
       This method is the base for several
       <i>
        ellipsographs
       </i>
       (see section below).
      </p>
      <p>
       <i>
        Remark:
       </i>
       Similar to the variation of the paper strip method 1 a
       <i>
        variation of the paper strip method 2
       </i>
       can be established (see diagram) by cutting the part between the axes into halves.
      </p>
      <ul class='gallery mw-gallery-traditional "float-left'>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 235px">
        <div style="width: 235px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 230px;">
          <div style="margin:15px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Archimedes_Trammel.gif">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Archimedes_Trammel.gif/150px-Archimedes_Trammel.gif" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Archimedes_Trammel.gif/225px-Archimedes_Trammel.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ee/Archimedes_Trammel.gif 2x" width="150"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Trammel_of_Archimedes" title="Trammel of Archimedes">
            Trammel of Archimedes
           </a>
           (principle)
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 235px">
        <div style="width: 235px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 230px;">
          <div style="margin:15px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:L-Ellipsenzirkel.png">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="1120" data-file-width="1115" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/75/L-Ellipsenzirkel.png/149px-L-Ellipsenzirkel.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/75/L-Ellipsenzirkel.png/224px-L-Ellipsenzirkel.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/75/L-Ellipsenzirkel.png/299px-L-Ellipsenzirkel.png 2x" width="149"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           Ellipsograph due to
           <a href="/wiki/Benjamin_Bramer" title="Benjamin Bramer">
            Benjamin Bramer
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 235px">
        <div style="width: 235px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 230px;">
          <div style="margin:44px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_Ellipses_at_Slider_Side.gif">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="650" height="92" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_Ellipses_at_Slider_Side.gif/200px-Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_Ellipses_at_Slider_Side.gif" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_Ellipses_at_Slider_Side.gif/300px-Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_Ellipses_at_Slider_Side.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_Ellipses_at_Slider_Side.gif/400px-Ellipses_with_SliderCrank_Ellipses_at_Slider_Side.gif 2x" width="200"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           Variation of the paper strip method 2
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Elliko-skm.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="261" data-file-width="296" height="220" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/25/Elliko-skm.svg/250px-Elliko-skm.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/25/Elliko-skm.svg/375px-Elliko-skm.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/25/Elliko-skm.svg/500px-Elliko-skm.svg.png 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Elliko-skm.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Approximation of an ellipse with osculating circles
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Approximation_by_osculating_circles">
        Approximation by osculating circles
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: Approximation by osculating circles">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       From section
       <i>
        metric properties
       </i>
       one gets:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        The radius of curvature at the vertices
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/50193d5201b7ff4d46487f5d5e58ee9c1e6f29fc" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.853ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        is:
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {b^{2}}{a}}\ ,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
                <mfrac>
                 <msup>
                  <mi>
                   b
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                </mfrac>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\tfrac {b^{2}}{a}}\ ,}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {b^{2}}{a}}\ ,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/27cd26d6275947639b9652bd79ae034db300e2b1" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:3.601ex; height:3.843ex;"/>
        </span>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        the radius of curvature at the co-vertices
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{3},V_{4}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 3
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 4
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle V_{3},V_{4}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{3},V_{4}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/513a56a9520740a48e22a545ca1163143d48b5a7" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.853ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        is:
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {a^{2}}{b}}\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
                <mfrac>
                 <msup>
                  <mi>
                   a
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                </mfrac>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\tfrac {a^{2}}{b}}\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {a^{2}}{b}}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ce93e1ff96829fd6766eec935cd386eb1be2d6e9" style="vertical-align: -1.338ex; width:3.765ex; height:4.176ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The diagram shows an easy way to find the centers
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle C_{1}=(a-{\tfrac {b^{2}}{a}},0),\;C_{3}=(0,b-{\tfrac {a^{2}}{b}})}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               C
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               C
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                3
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <mi>
                 b
                </mi>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle C_{1}=(a-{\tfrac {b^{2}}{a}},0),\;C_{3}=(0,b-{\tfrac {a^{2}}{b}})}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle C_{1}=(a-{\tfrac {b^{2}}{a}},0),\;C_{3}=(0,b-{\tfrac {a^{2}}{b}})}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f92226a8f817bd236857e39f714b29f7b72a1732" style="vertical-align: -1.338ex; width:34.138ex; height:4.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       of curvature at vertex
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{1}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="V_{1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/adfdbc929f16cb00bb43289c223651b41f7b9f80" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.409ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       and co-vertex
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{3}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                3
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{3}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="V_{3}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e240a0a3bcd3a6d628a5b796501771dff86ca493" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.409ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       , resp.:
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        (1) mark the auxiliary point
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle H=(a,b)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               H
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle H=(a,b)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle H=(a,b)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ae0f0db9858b57cc26af6f096a68909c1791bc75" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:10.233ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        and draw the linesegment
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1}V_{3}\ ,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 3
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle V_{1}V_{3}\ ,}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1}V_{3}\ ,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/70b850fcb6948ff7d314542a7e9798321db59a41" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:6.046ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
       <dd>
        (2) draw the line through
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle H}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               H
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle H}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="H" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/75a9edddcca2f782014371f75dca39d7e13a9c1b" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:2.064ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        , which is perpendicular to the line
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1}V_{2}\ ,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                V
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle V_{1}V_{2}\ ,}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1}V_{2}\ ,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0ad4e71fe712ab2bda43074d16f98acf675de814" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:6.046ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
       <dd>
        (3) the intersection points of this line with the axes are the centers of the oasculating circles.
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       (proof: simple calculation.)
      </p>
      <p>
       The centers for the remaining vertices are found by symmetry.
      </p>
      <p>
       With help of a
       <a href="/wiki/French_curve" title="French curve">
        French curve
       </a>
       one draws a curve, which has smooth contact to the osculating circles.
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Steiner_generation_of_an_ellipse">
        Steiner generation of an ellipse
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: Steiner generation of an ellipse">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-steiner-e.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="248" data-file-width="290" height="214" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/Ellipse-steiner-e.svg/250px-Ellipse-steiner-e.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/Ellipse-steiner-e.svg/375px-Ellipse-steiner-e.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/Ellipse-steiner-e.svg/500px-Ellipse-steiner-e.svg.png 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-steiner-e.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: Steiner generation
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:202px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_construction_-_parallelogram_method.gif">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="400" height="200" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Ellipse_construction_-_parallelogram_method.gif/200px-Ellipse_construction_-_parallelogram_method.gif" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Ellipse_construction_-_parallelogram_method.gif/300px-Ellipse_construction_-_parallelogram_method.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/6a/Ellipse_construction_-_parallelogram_method.gif 2x" width="200"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_construction_-_parallelogram_method.gif" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: Steiner generation
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The following method to construct single points of an ellipse relies on the
       <a href="/wiki/Steiner_conic" title="Steiner conic">
        Steiner generation of a non degenerate conic section
       </a>
       :
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Given two
        <a href="/wiki/Pencil_(mathematics)" title="Pencil (mathematics)">
         pencils
        </a>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle B(U),B(V)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               B
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               U
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mi>
               B
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle B(U),B(V)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="B(U),B(V)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/af08edb0e578942cd0c7d746e6a0607fea80d389" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:11.75ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        of lines at two points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle U,V}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               U
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle U,V}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="U,V" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7681409ec5fffdb272f536757c1211fe0151a9b2" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:4.604ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        (all lines containing
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle U}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               U
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle U}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="U" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/458a728f53b9a0274f059cd695e067c430956025" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.783ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle V}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle V}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="V" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/af0f6064540e84211d0ffe4dac72098adfa52845" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.787ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        , respectively) and a projective but not perspective mapping
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle \pi }" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               π
               <!-- π -->
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle \pi }
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="\pi " aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9be4ba0bb8df3af72e90a0535fabcc17431e540a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.332ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
        </span>
        of
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle B(U)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               B
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               U
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle B(U)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="B(U)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f5f40b0baca9532aa8c1106155a0cae6ec77a2ce" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:5.356ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        onto
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle B(V)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               B
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle B(V)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="B(V)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/3240b15b8d5cc8b968454438e642b397e0f4414c" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:5.361ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        , then the intersection points of corresponding lines form a non-degenerate projective conic section.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       For the generation of points of the ellipse
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f6aa55c90da259c96a7894fe6e7555d2428cdec3" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:12.198ex; height:4.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       one uses the pencils at the vertices
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/50193d5201b7ff4d46487f5d5e58ee9c1e6f29fc" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.853ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       . Let
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle P=(0,b)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              P
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle P=(0,b)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle P=(0,b)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/83a4665836d2cc95b60f23b16bc87736034e12e2" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:9.847ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       be an upper co-vertex of the ellipse and
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle A=(-a,2b),B=(a,2b)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              A
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              B
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle A=(-a,2b),B=(a,2b)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle A=(-a,2b),B=(a,2b)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/c54576294362a34a4ba755dabf6dd83aad9bb1e4" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:25.012ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       .
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle P}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              P
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle P}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="P" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b4dc73bf40314945ff376bd363916a738548d40a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.745ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       is the center of the rectangle
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2},B,A}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              B
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              A
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2},B,A}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1},V_{2},B,A}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/c3a743e158209b7ed8ae821ad842a2120745eac2" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:11.428ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       . The side
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\overline {AB}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mover>
               <mrow>
                <mi>
                 A
                </mi>
                <mi>
                 B
                </mi>
               </mrow>
               <mo accent="false">
                ¯
                <!-- ¯ -->
               </mo>
              </mover>
             </mrow>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\overline {AB}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\overline {AB}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/70f91c39c977790f3cc4e768d5aad89bb1696110" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:3.622ex; height:3.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       of the rectangle is divided into n equal spaced line segments and this division is projected parallel with the diagonal
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle AV_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              A
             </mi>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle AV_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle AV_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0ad09dac04f9df792979f555864314c2283c0a28" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:4.153ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       as direction onto the line segment
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\overline {V_{1}B}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mover>
               <mrow>
                <msub>
                 <mi>
                  V
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   1
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msub>
                <mi>
                 B
                </mi>
               </mrow>
               <mo accent="false">
                ¯
                <!-- ¯ -->
               </mo>
              </mover>
             </mrow>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\overline {V_{1}B}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\overline {V_{1}B}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/2717941417acc1c87dfab3dae8a1721814187284" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:4.288ex; height:3.343ex;"/>
       </span>
       and assign the division as shown in the diagram. The parallel projection together with the reverse of the orientation is part of the projective mapping between the pencils at
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{1}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="V_{1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/adfdbc929f16cb00bb43289c223651b41f7b9f80" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.409ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       and
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
