                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="V_{2}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ceaa689a894f5020a7b46177d201cbce2d41122b" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.409ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       needed. The intersection points of any two related lines
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{1}B_{i}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               B
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi>
                i
               </mi>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{1}B_{i}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{1}B_{i}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/19f1f0e5d776460a59d14b0721f922e4f9d7fe8a" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:4.973ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       and
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle V_{2}A_{i}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               V
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               A
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi>
                i
               </mi>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle V_{2}A_{i}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle V_{2}A_{i}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f1c83b91d0029c26a60932747cb3af85f10a9e69" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:4.952ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       are points of the uniquely defined ellipse. With help of the points
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle C_{1},\dotsc }" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               C
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mo>
              …
              <!-- … -->
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle C_{1},\dotsc }
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle C_{1},\dotsc }" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7a7b05d5f5948e67bd86ba8bb00e217f9875b3b9" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:6.473ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       the points of the second quarter of the ellipse can be determined. Analogously one gets the points of the lower half of the ellipse.
      </p>
      <p>
       <i>
        Remark:
       </i>
      </p>
      <ol>
       <li>
        The Steiner generation exists for hyperbolas and parabolas, too.
       </li>
       <li>
        The Steiner generation is sometimes called a
        <i>
         parallelogram method
        </i>
        because one can use other points rather than the vertices, which starts with a parallelogram instead of a rectangle.
       </li>
      </ol>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Ellipsographs">
        Ellipsographs
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: Ellipsographs">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       Most technical instruments for drawing ellipses are based on the second paperstrip method.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="external text" href="http://www.history.didaktik.mathematik.uni-wuerzburg.de/ausstell/ellipsenzirkel/index.html" rel="nofollow">
         Ellipsenzirkel (German)
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="external text" href="http://collectingme.com/drawing/" rel="nofollow">
         Drawing instruments
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       For more principles of ellipsographs:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellipsographe" title="fr:Ellipsographe">
         Ellipsographe (French)
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Inscribed_angles_for_ellipses_and_the_3-point-form">
        Inscribed angles for ellipses and the 3-point-form
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21" title="Edit section: Inscribed angles for ellipses and the 3-point-form">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Circles">
        Circles
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=22" title="Edit section: Circles">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Inscribe-a-c.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="167" data-file-width="155" height="237" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/Inscribe-a-c.svg/220px-Inscribe-a-c.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/Inscribe-a-c.svg/330px-Inscribe-a-c.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/Inscribe-a-c.svg/440px-Inscribe-a-c.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Inscribe-a-c.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Circle: inscribed angle theorem
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       A circle with equation
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+(y-d)^{2}=r^{2},\ r&gt;0\ ,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              x
             </mi>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              c
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              y
             </mi>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              d
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               r
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mtext>
             </mtext>
             <mi>
              r
             </mi>
             <mo>
              &gt;
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
             <mtext>
             </mtext>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+(y-d)^{2}=r^{2},\ r&gt;0\ ,}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+(y-d)^{2}=r^{2},\ r&gt;0\ ,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f361477a5ed69ec35bed88eb1907070a36897797" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:32.309ex; height:3.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       is uniquely determined by three points
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle (x_{1},y_{1}),\;(x_{2},y_{2}),\;(x_{3},y_{3})}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mspace width="thickmathspace">
             </mspace>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                3
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                3
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle (x_{1},y_{1}),\;(x_{2},y_{2}),\;(x_{3},y_{3})}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle (x_{1},y_{1}),\;(x_{2},y_{2}),\;(x_{3},y_{3})}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/60104e697cc3999f38d1c30eb7d49d3cc3cc53d2" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:25.62ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       not on a line. A simple way to determine the parameters
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle c,d,r}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              c
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              d
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              r
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle c,d,r}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle c,d,r}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/74ef2ea3a258a52290ca9d1d4c052b067fd60d21" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.339ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       uses the
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Inscribed_angle_theorem" title="Inscribed angle theorem">
         inscribed angle theorem
        </a>
       </i>
       for circles:
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        For four points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                y
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               i
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               1
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               2
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               3
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               4
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7c7152f9725b9042dac52c7eae5955763ffda4e1" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:26.216ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        (see diagram) the following statement is true:
       </dd>
       <dd>
        The four points are on a circle if and only if the angles at
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{3}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 3
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{3}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P_{3}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f92db8e65bb75b79799f0f3a29e975b37e227069" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.547ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{4}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 4
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{4}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P_{4}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/48763cb9875de7b4125c40e95e542e775c1cbc4e" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.547ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        are equal.
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       Usually one measures inscribed angles by
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Degree_(angle)" title="Degree (angle)">
         degree
        </a>
       </i>
       or
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Radian" title="Radian">
         radian
        </a>
       </i>
       . In order to get an equation of a circle determined by three points, the following measurement is more convenient:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        In order to
        <b>
         measure an angle
        </b>
        between two lines with equations
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle y=m_{1}x+d_{1},\ y=m_{2}x+d_{2}\ ,m_{1}\neq m_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                d
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                d
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ≠
               <!-- ≠ -->
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle y=m_{1}x+d_{1},\ y=m_{2}x+d_{2}\ ,m_{1}\neq m_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle y=m_{1}x+d_{1},\ y=m_{2}x+d_{2}\ ,m_{1}\neq m_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/71b64b28b0881f58e4fdd8f6355852455ccf1dd3" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:40.081ex; height:2.676ex;"/>
        </span>
        one uses the quotient
       </li>
      </ul>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <dl>
         <dd>
          <span class="mwe-math-element">
           <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
            <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {1+m_{1}\cdot m_{2}}{m_{2}-m_{1}}}\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
             <semantics>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mfrac>
                  <mrow>
                   <mn>
                    1
                   </mn>
                   <mo>
                    +
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    ⋅
                    <!-- ⋅ -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                  </mrow>
                  <mrow>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                  </mrow>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
                <mtext>
                </mtext>
                <mo>
                 .
                </mo>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
               {\displaystyle {\frac {1+m_{1}\cdot m_{2}}{m_{2}-m_{1}}}\ .}
              </annotation>
             </semantics>
            </math>
           </span>
           <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {1+m_{1}\cdot m_{2}}{m_{2}-m_{1}}}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ca7279ee0a4acd2f0b12ea9c8b42866d957063f1" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:13.935ex; height:5.509ex;"/>
          </span>
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </dd>
       <dd>
        This expression is the
        <i>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cotangent" title="Cotangent">
          cotangent
         </a>
         of the angle between the two lines
        </i>
        .
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       <b>
        Inscribed angle theorem for circles:
       </b>
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        For four points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                y
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               i
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               1
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               2
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               3
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               4
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7c7152f9725b9042dac52c7eae5955763ffda4e1" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:26.216ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        , no three of them on a line (see diagram), the following statement is true:
       </dd>
       <dd>
        The four points are on a circle, if and only if the angles at
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{3}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 3
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{3}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P_{3}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f92db8e65bb75b79799f0f3a29e975b37e227069" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.547ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{4}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 4
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{4}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P_{4}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/48763cb9875de7b4125c40e95e542e775c1cbc4e" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.547ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        are equal. In the sense of the measurement above, that means, if
        <dl>
         <dd>
          <span class="mwe-math-element">
           <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
            <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {(x_{4}-x_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})+(y_{4}-y_{1})(y_{4}-y_{2})}{(y_{4}-y_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})-(y_{4}-y_{2})(x_{4}-x_{1})}}={\frac {(x_{3}-x_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})+(y_{3}-y_{1})(y_{3}-y_{2})}{(y_{3}-y_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})-(y_{3}-y_{2})(x_{3}-x_{1})}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
             <semantics>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mfrac>
                  <mrow>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>

                   <mo>

                    <!-- − -->

                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">

                   <mo>

                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">

                  </mrow>
                  <mrow>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                  </mrow>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
               {\displaystyle {\frac {(x_{4}-x_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})+(y_{4}-y_{1})(y_{4}-y_{2})}{(y_{4}-y_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})-(y_{4}-y_{2})(x_{4}-x_{1})}}={\frac {(x_{3}-x_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})+(y_{3}-y_{1})(y_{3}-y_{2})}{(y_{3}-y_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})-(y_{3}-y_{2})(x_{3}-x_{1})}}}
              </annotation>
             </semantics>
            </math>
           </span>
           <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {(x_{4}-x_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})+(y_{4}-y_{1})(y_{4}-y_{2})}{(y_{4}-y_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})-(y_{4}-y_{2})(x_{4}-x_{1})}}={\frac {(x_{3}-x_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})+(y_{3}-y_{1})(y_{3}-y_{2})}{(y_{3}-y_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})-(y_{3}-y_{2})(x_{3}-x_{1})}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/c7f6c326d7be675e4e2b1244f823a63870f654e0" style="vertical-align: -2.671ex; width:84.268ex; height:6.509ex;"/>
          </span>
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       At first the masure is available for chords, which are not parallel to the y-axis, only. But the final formula works for any chord.
      </p>
      <p>
       A consequence of the inscribed angle theorem for circles is the
      </p>
      <p>
       <b>
        3-point-form of a circle's equation:
       </b>
       <br/>
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        One gets the equation of the circle determined by 3 points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i})}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                y
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i})}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P_i=(x_i,y_i)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7c26cac554df0540ff5fa66cfbcd6f9c945823cf" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:12.302ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        not on a line by a conversion of the equation
        <dl>

      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Ellipses">
        Ellipses
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=23" title="Edit section: Ellipses">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       In this section one considers ellipses with an equation
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {(x-c)^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {(y-d)^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1\quad \leftrightarrow \quad (x-c)^{2}+{\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}(y-d)^{2}=a^{2},\quad c,d,\in \mathbb {R} ,\ a&gt;0\ ,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  (
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  −
                  <!-- − -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                 <msup>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   )
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                </mrow>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  (
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  −
                  <!-- − -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  d
                 </mi>
                 <msup>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   )
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                </mrow>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               1
              </mn>
              <mspace width="1em">
              </mspace>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               ↔
               <!-- ↔ -->
              </mo>
              <mspace width="1em">
              </mspace>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                )
               </mo>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                )
               </mo>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                a
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mspace width="1em">
              </mspace>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ∈
               <!-- ∈ -->
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi mathvariant="double-struck">
                R
               </mi>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               &gt;
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\frac {(x-c)^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {(y-d)^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1\quad \leftrightarrow \quad (x-c)^{2}+{\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}(y-d)^{2}=a^{2},\quad c,d,\in \mathbb {R} ,\ a&gt;0\ ,}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {(x-c)^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {(y-d)^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1\quad \leftrightarrow \quad (x-c)^{2}+{\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}(y-d)^{2}=a^{2},\quad c,d,\in \mathbb {R} ,\ a&gt;0\ ,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4a8cff5f59a1d8616931d029d7e18363b0ba365e" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:80.461ex; height:6.176ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       where the ratio
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mfrac>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 b
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </mfrac>
             </mrow>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ab2794461fc797a7b828968ba9e10a9e7f50f9c7" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:3.12ex; height:6.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       is
       <i>
        fixed
       </i>
       . With the abbreviation
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\color {blue}q}={\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}\ }" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle mathcolor="blue">
               <mi>
                q
               </mi>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mfrac>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 b
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </mfrac>
             </mrow>
             <mtext>
             </mtext>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\color {blue}q}={\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}\ }
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\color {blue}q}={\frac {a^{2}}{b^{2}}}\ }" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9c1a589abc569cc74f0825611e0aa41c61246822" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:7.869ex; height:6.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       one gets the more convenient form
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+{\color {blue}q}\;(y-d)^{2}=a^{2},\quad c,d\in \mathbb {R} ,a&gt;0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                )
               </mo>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle mathcolor="#0000ff">
                <mi>
                 q
                </mi>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <mspace width="thickmathspace">
              </mspace>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                )
               </mo>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                a
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mspace width="1em">
              </mspace>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ∈
               <!-- ∈ -->
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi mathvariant="double-struck">
                R
               </mi>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mo>
               &gt;
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+{\color {blue}q}\;(y-d)^{2}=a^{2},\quad c,d\in \mathbb {R} ,a&gt;0}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+{\color {blue}q}\;(y-d)^{2}=a^{2},\quad c,d\in \mathbb {R} ,a&gt;0}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/6b5b3f0b415ea7b11e04ad65f2e31a25f5c2a6a0" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:43.71ex; height:3.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle q&gt;0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               q
              </mi>
              <mo>
               &gt;
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle q&gt;0}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle q&gt;0}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/482e0a33d9e8fd6307b5f68a5182c2d0d14efc9c" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.33ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        <i>
         fixed
        </i>
        .
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Such ellipses have their axes parallel to the coordinate axes and their eccentricity fixed. Their major axes are parallel to the x-axis if
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle q&gt;1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              q
             </mi>
             <mo>
              &gt;
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle q&gt;1}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="q&gt;1" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/fe3606e1cf4480eb39e5ddcd46d4dae2067c0b5a" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.33ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       and parallel to the y-axis if
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle q&lt;1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              q
             </mi>
             <mo>
              &lt;
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle q&lt;1}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="q&lt;1" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4e1c80e174f560a6b2395c2301d6b98a67e7d624" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.33ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Inscribe-a-e.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="148" data-file-width="190" height="171" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Inscribe-a-e.svg/220px-Inscribe-a-e.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Inscribe-a-e.svg/330px-Inscribe-a-e.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Inscribe-a-e.svg/440px-Inscribe-a-e.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Inscribe-a-e.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Inscribed angle theorem for an ellipse
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Like a circle, such an ellipse is determined by three points not on a line.
      </p>
      <p>
       In this more general case one introduces the following measurement of an angle,:
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5">
        <a href="#cite_note-5">
         [5]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6">
        <a href="#cite_note-6">
         [6]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        In order to
        <b>
         measure an angle
        </b>
        between two lines with equations
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle y=m_{1}x+d_{1},\ y=m_{2}x+d_{2}\ ,m_{1}\neq m_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                d
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                d
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ≠
               <!-- ≠ -->
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                m
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle y=m_{1}x+d_{1},\ y=m_{2}x+d_{2}\ ,m_{1}\neq m_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle y=m_{1}x+d_{1},\ y=m_{2}x+d_{2}\ ,m_{1}\neq m_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/71b64b28b0881f58e4fdd8f6355852455ccf1dd3" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:40.081ex; height:2.676ex;"/>
        </span>
        one uses the quotient
       </li>
      </ul>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <dl>
         <dd>
          <span class="mwe-math-element">
           <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
            <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {1+{\color {blue}q}\;m_{1}\cdot m_{2}}{m_{2}-m_{1}}}\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
             <semantics>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mfrac>
                  <mrow>
                   <mn>
                    1
                   </mn>
                   <mo>
                    +
                   </mo>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mstyle mathcolor="blue">
                     <mi>
                      q
                     </mi>
                    </mstyle>
                   </mrow>
                   <mspace width="thickmathspace">
                   </mspace>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    ⋅
                    <!-- ⋅ -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                  </mrow>
                  <mrow>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     m
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                  </mrow>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
                <mtext>
                </mtext>
                <mo>
                 .
                </mo>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
               {\displaystyle {\frac {1+{\color {blue}q}\;m_{1}\cdot m_{2}}{m_{2}-m_{1}}}\ .}
              </annotation>
             </semantics>
            </math>
           </span>
           <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {1+{\color {blue}q}\;m_{1}\cdot m_{2}}{m_{2}-m_{1}}}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/5626aae8cd3e23171db1ca81bf4f44ce2ef77940" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:15.65ex; height:5.676ex;"/>
          </span>
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Inscribed_angle_theorem_for_ellipses">
        Inscribed angle theorem for ellipses
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=24" title="Edit section: Inscribed angle theorem for ellipses">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        For four points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                y
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               i
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               1
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               2
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               3
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               4
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i}),\ i=1,2,3,4,}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7c7152f9725b9042dac52c7eae5955763ffda4e1" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:26.216ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        , no three of them on a line (see diagram), the following statement is true:
       </dd>
       <dd>
        The four points are on an ellipse with equation
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+q\;(y-d)^{2}=a^{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                )
               </mo>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mi>
               q
              </mi>
              <mspace width="thickmathspace">
              </mspace>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mo stretchy="false">
                )
               </mo>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                a
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+q\;(y-d)^{2}=a^{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle (x-c)^{2}+q\;(y-d)^{2}=a^{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9e8f0a67f918997dba88fc09bcc8373c63adce60" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:26.053ex; height:3.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        , if and only if the angles at
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{3}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>

           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>

        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{4}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">

        </span>
        are equal in the sense of the measurement above—that is, if

              <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
               {\displaystyle {\frac {(x_{4}-x_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;(y_{4}-y_{1})(y_{4}-y_{2})}{(y_{4}-y_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})-(y_{4}-y_{2})(x_{4}-x_{1})}}={\frac {(x_{3}-x_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;(y_{3}-y_{1})(y_{3}-y_{2})}{(y_{3}-y_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})-(y_{3}-y_{2})(x_{3}-x_{1})}}\ .}

             </semantics>
            </math>
           </span>
           <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {(x_{4}-x_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;(y_{4}-y_{1})(y_{4}-y_{2})}{(y_{4}-y_{1})(x_{4}-x_{2})-(y_{4}-y_{2})(x_{4}-x_{1})}}={\frac {(x_{3}-x_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;(y_{3}-y_{1})(y_{3}-y_{2})}{(y_{3}-y_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})-(y_{3}-y_{2})(x_{3}-x_{1})}}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7da6aeeea28cf4476e867ce47962503c61c250c4" style="vertical-align: -2.671ex; width:88.925ex; height:6.509ex;"/>
          </span>
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       At first the measure is available only for chords which are not parallel to the y-axis. But the final formula works for any chord. The proof follows from a straightforward calculation. For the direction of proof given that the points are on an ellipse, one can assume that the center of the ellipse is the origin.
      </p>
      <p>
       A consequence of the inscribed angle theorem for ellipses is the
      </p>
      <p>
       <b>
        3-point-form of an ellipse's equation:
       </b>
       <br/>
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        One gets the equation of the ellipse determined by 3 points
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i})}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                y
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 i
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{i}=(x_{i},y_{i})}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P_i=(x_i,y_i)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7c26cac554df0540ff5fa66cfbcd6f9c945823cf" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:12.302ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        not on a line by a conversion of the equation
        <dl>
         <dd>
          <span class="mwe-math-element">
           <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">

             <semantics>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">

                    )
                   </mo>
                  </mrow>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
                <mo>
                 =
                </mo>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mfrac>
                  <mrow>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo>
                    +
                   </mo>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mstyle mathcolor="blue">
                     <mi>
                      q
                     </mi>
                    </mstyle>
                   </mrow>
                   <mspace width="thickmathspace">
                   </mspace>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
