                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                  </mrow>
                  <mrow>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     y
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    (
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      3
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo>
                    −
                    <!-- − -->
                   </mo>
                   <msub>
                    <mi>
                     x
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      1
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msub>
                   <mo stretchy="false">
                    )
                   </mo>
                  </mrow>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
                <mtext>
                </mtext>
                <mo>
                 .
                </mo>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
              <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
               {\displaystyle {\frac {({\color {green}x}-x_{1})({\color {green}x}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;({\color {red}y}-y_{1})({\color {red}y}-y_{2})}{({\color {red}y}-y_{1})({\color {green}x}-x_{2})-({\color {red}y}-y_{2})({\color {green}x}-x_{1})}}={\frac {(x_{3}-x_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;(y_{3}-y_{1})(y_{3}-y_{2})}{(y_{3}-y_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})-(y_{3}-y_{2})(x_{3}-x_{1})}}\ .}
              </annotation>
             </semantics>
            </math>
           </span>
           <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {({\color {green}x}-x_{1})({\color {green}x}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;({\color {red}y}-y_{1})({\color {red}y}-y_{2})}{({\color {red}y}-y_{1})({\color {green}x}-x_{2})-({\color {red}y}-y_{2})({\color {green}x}-x_{1})}}={\frac {(x_{3}-x_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})+{\color {blue}q}\;(y_{3}-y_{1})(y_{3}-y_{2})}{(y_{3}-y_{1})(x_{3}-x_{2})-(y_{3}-y_{2})(x_{3}-x_{1})}}\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9ba65ac93fea6b0e34904e91a9be931b15ba9cb9" style="vertical-align: -2.671ex; width:84.741ex; height:6.509ex;"/>
          </span>
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Pole-polar_relation_for_an_ellipse">
        Pole-polar relation for an ellipse
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=25" title="Edit section: Pole-polar relation for an ellipse">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-pol.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="171" data-file-width="259" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7e/Ellipse-pol.svg/250px-Ellipse-pol.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7e/Ellipse-pol.svg/375px-Ellipse-pol.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7e/Ellipse-pol.svg/500px-Ellipse-pol.svg.png 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse-pol.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Ellipse: pole-polar relation
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Any ellipse can be described in a suitable coordinate system by an equation
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f6aa55c90da259c96a7894fe6e7555d2428cdec3" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:12.198ex; height:4.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       . The equation of the tangent at a point
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/43812be6208b39d605ab5dd77c9e6007eb6180f5" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:13.066ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       of the ellipse is
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {x_{0}x}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y_{0}y}{b^{2}}}=1.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   x
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    0
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                </mrow>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   y
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    0
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                </mrow>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mstyle>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1.
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\tfrac {x_{0}x}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y_{0}y}{b^{2}}}=1.}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\tfrac {x_{0}x}{a^{2}}}+{\tfrac {y_{0}y}{b^{2}}}=1.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/74d66832c2086b0593ac415d61deed01ad1d6fb7" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:14.587ex; height:4.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       If one allows point
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <msub>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                0
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/43812be6208b39d605ab5dd77c9e6007eb6180f5" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:13.066ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       to be an arbitrary point different from the origin, then
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        point
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})\neq (0,0)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 0
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                x
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 0
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                y
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 0
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ≠
               <!-- ≠ -->
              </mo>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})\neq (0,0)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{0}=(x_{0},y_{0})\neq (0,0)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/eddf871c3002a5574606c0ef1b294e66626c969a" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:21.332ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        is mapped onto the line
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {x_{0}x}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y_{0}y}{b^{2}}}=1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   x
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    0
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                 <mi>
                  x
                 </mi>
                </mrow>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <msub>
                  <mi>
                   y
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    0
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msub>
                 <mi>
                  y
                 </mi>
                </mrow>
                <msup>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                 </mrow>
                </msup>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               1
              </mn>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\frac {x_{0}x}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y_{0}y}{b^{2}}}=1}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {x_{0}x}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y_{0}y}{b^{2}}}=1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/96d4ef5e2daac6f69963c1c3596a97972bc67497" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:15.836ex; height:5.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        , not through the center of the ellipse.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       This relation between points and lines is a
       <a href="/wiki/Bijection" title="Bijection">
        bijection
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Inverse_function" title="Inverse function">
        inverse function
       </a>
       maps
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        line
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle y=mx+d,\ d\neq 0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mi>
               m
              </mi>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               +
              </mo>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               d
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ≠
               <!-- ≠ -->
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle y=mx+d,\ d\neq 0}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle y=mx+d,\ d\neq 0}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/09f2c83548a8b8b5d88d097b44ec89545db70d76" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:18.772ex; height:2.676ex;"/>
        </span>
        onto the point
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle \left(-{\frac {ma^{2}}{d}},{\frac {b^{2}}{d}}\right)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow>
               <mo>
                (
               </mo>
               <mrow>
                <mo>
                 −
                 <!-- − -->
                </mo>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mfrac>
                  <mrow>
                   <mi>
                    m
                   </mi>
                   <msup>
                    <mi>
                     a
                    </mi>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                    </mrow>
                   </msup>
                  </mrow>
                  <mi>
                   d
                  </mi>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
                <mo>
                 ,
                </mo>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mfrac>
                  <msup>
                   <mi>
                    b
                   </mi>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mn>
                     2
                    </mn>
                   </mrow>
                  </msup>
                  <mi>
                   d
                  </mi>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
               </mrow>
               <mo>
                )
               </mo>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle \left(-{\frac {ma^{2}}{d}},{\frac {b^{2}}{d}}\right)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle \left(-{\frac {ma^{2}}{d}},{\frac {b^{2}}{d}}\right)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/306f81ecd5b1453e90919b88171a8119d554929d" style="vertical-align: -2.505ex; width:14.312ex; height:6.343ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
       </li>
      </ul>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        line
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle x=c,\ c\neq 0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ≠
               <!-- ≠ -->
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle x=c,\ c\neq 0}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle x=c,\ c\neq 0}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/49d068df673bcb491813b55e60e239bce8f170e4" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:12.317ex; height:2.676ex;"/>
        </span>
        onto the point
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle \left({\frac {a^{2}}{c}},0\right)\ .}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow>
               <mo>
                (
               </mo>
               <mrow>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mfrac>
                  <msup>
                   <mi>
                    a
                   </mi>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mn>
                     2
                    </mn>
                   </mrow>
                  </msup>
                  <mi>
                   c
                  </mi>
                 </mfrac>
                </mrow>
                <mo>
                 ,
                </mo>
                <mn>
                 0
                </mn>
               </mrow>
               <mo>
                )
               </mo>
              </mrow>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle \left({\frac {a^{2}}{c}},0\right)\ .}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle \left({\frac {a^{2}}{c}},0\right)\ .}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/7f96865dffc35fb22ae440269b8b8c88bd21a3c3" style="vertical-align: -2.505ex; width:10.352ex; height:6.343ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       Such a relation between points and lines generated by a conic is called
       <b>
        pole-polar relation
       </b>
       or just
       <i>
        polarity
       </i>
       . The pole is the point, the polar the line. See
       <a href="/wiki/Pole_and_polar" title="Pole and polar">
        Pole and polar
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       By calculation one checks the following properties of the pole-polar relation of the ellipse:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        For a point (pole)
        <i>
         on
        </i>
        the ellipse the polar is the tangent at this point (see diagram:
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{1},\ p_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                p
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{1},\ p_{1}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{1},\ p_{1}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/52541841fd849efd2bb0fdc18fbea0821a7595f5" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:6.385ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        ).
       </li>
       <li>
        For a pole
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b4dc73bf40314945ff376bd363916a738548d40a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.745ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        <i>
         outside
        </i>
        the ellipse the intersection points of its polar with the ellipse are the tangency points of the two tangents passing
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               P
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="P" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/b4dc73bf40314945ff376bd363916a738548d40a" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.745ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
        </span>
        (see diagram:
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle P_{2},\ p_{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                P
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                p
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle P_{2},\ p_{2}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle P_{2},\ p_{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/189b49715207295700235051fc3ccba5bfa4ad1e" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:6.385ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        ).
       </li>
       <li>
        For a point
        <i>
         within
        </i>
        the ellipse the polar has no point with the ellipse in common. (see diagram:
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle F_{1},\ l_{1}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                F
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mtext>
              </mtext>
              <msub>
               <mi>
                l
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 1
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle F_{1},\ l_{1}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle F_{1},\ l_{1}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/258159b84569c4654bddbb4216e0506aa91cfc2b" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:5.911ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
        </span>
        ).
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       <i>
        Remarks:
       </i>
      </p>
      <ol>
       <li>
        The intersection point of two polars is the pole of the line through their poles.
       </li>
       <li>
        The foci
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle (c,0),}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle (c,0),}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle (c,0),}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9c836197629d39b44d317854820d91ab9c027717" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:5.659ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle (-c,0)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mi>
               c
              </mi>
              <mo>
               ,
              </mo>
              <mn>
               0
              </mn>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle (-c,0)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle (-c,0)}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/067a2db8d009532c6cd93f67af513d10f5bb9f65" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:6.821ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        respectively and the directrices
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle x={\tfrac {a^{2}}{c}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
                <mfrac>
                 <msup>
                  <mi>
                   a
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                </mfrac>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle x={\tfrac {a^{2}}{c}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle x={\tfrac {a^{2}}{c}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/a970d8ac8f26c51f2f3e24329cef716641e664d3" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:6.965ex; height:3.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        and
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle x=-{\tfrac {a^{2}}{c}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mo>
               −
               <!-- − -->
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mstyle displaystyle="false" scriptlevel="0">
                <mfrac>
                 <msup>
                  <mi>
                   a
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                 <mi>
                  c
                 </mi>
                </mfrac>
               </mstyle>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle x=-{\tfrac {a^{2}}{c}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle x=-{\tfrac {a^{2}}{c}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/856c6cd402cbd3b9598f8bf91bb8d577e380691f" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:8.774ex; height:3.843ex;"/>
        </span>
        respectively belong to pairs of pole and polar.
       </li>
      </ol>
      <p>
       Pole-polar relations exist for hyperbolas and parabolas, too.
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Metric_properties">
        Metric properties
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=26" title="Edit section: Metric properties">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <p>
       All metric properties given below refer to an ellipse with equation
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\frac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mfrac>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 x
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </mfrac>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mfrac>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 y
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 b
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </mfrac>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle {\frac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle {\frac {x^{2}}{a^{2}}}+{\frac {y^{2}}{b^{2}}}=1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/3d7eb067b1ac196e718e5003ed60a0ea37577483" style="vertical-align: -2.171ex; width:13.372ex; height:6.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Area">
        Area
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=27" title="Edit section: Area">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Area" title="Area">
        area
       </a>
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               A
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mtext>
                ellipse
               </mtext>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="A_{\text{ellipse}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/c6bc36f4aeab5cdea71a09c2e52da9ea17d5f42e" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:6.369ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       enclosed by an ellipse is:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}=\pi ab}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                A
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mtext>
                 ellipse
                </mtext>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mi>
               π
               <!-- π -->
              </mi>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}=\pi ab}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}=\pi ab}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/90bf0b11e295bd02d735c21e64a48b63b82881e1" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:13.027ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       where
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="a" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ffd2487510aa438433a2579450ab2b3d557e5edc" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.23ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       and
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f11423fbb2e967f986e36804a8ae4271734917c3" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.998ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       are the lengths of the semi-major and semi-minor axes, respectively. The area formula
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \pi ab}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \pi ab}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle \pi ab}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e49e097530aa054f7782fc7de33b0a60418ff964" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:3.559ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       is intuitive: start with a circle of radius
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f11423fbb2e967f986e36804a8ae4271734917c3" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.998ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       (so its area is
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \pi b^{2}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \pi b^{2}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle \pi b^{2}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/daae6c6582e209b2d6435533560be6f3b3cdcad1" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:3.384ex; height:2.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       ) and stretch it by a factor
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a/b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo>
               /
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a/b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="a/b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4a1b6c014398323cb45578581a536033fce1b28c" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:3.39ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       to make an ellipse. This scales the area by the same factor:
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \pi b^{2}(a/b)=\pi ab.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo>
               /
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mo>
              .
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \pi b^{2}(a/b)=\pi ab.}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle \pi b^{2}(a/b)=\pi ab.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f398e64c38c92a549220974e9ac6b5f2b581be38" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:15.888ex; height:3.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       It is also easy to rigorously prove the area formula using
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Definite_integral" title="Definite integral">
        integration
       </a>
       as follows. Equation (
       <b>
        <a href="#math_1">
         1
        </a>
       </b>
       ) can be rewritten as
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle y(x)=b{\sqrt {1-x^{2}/a^{2}}}.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              y
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              x
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <msqrt>
               <mn>
                1
               </mn>
               <mo>
                −
                <!-- − -->
               </mo>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 x
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mo>
                 /
                </mo>
               </mrow>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </msqrt>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              .
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle y(x)=b{\sqrt {1-x^{2}/a^{2}}}.}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle y(x)=b{\sqrt {1-x^{2}/a^{2}}}.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f1bd94962277ce53a22e9957a28a9374bf06ff32" style="vertical-align: -1.671ex; width:21.194ex; height:4.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       For
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle x\in [-a,a],}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              x
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ∈
              <!-- ∈ -->
             </mo>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              [
             </mo>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              ]
             </mo>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle x\in [-a,a],}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle x\in [-a,a],}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/fb19e5015712fa6f6c57d3f334266c73d7782434" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:11.413ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       this curve is the top half of the ellipse. So twice the integral of
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle y(x)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              y
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mi>
              x
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle y(x)}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="y(x)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e871993bfd131a8b0c3591c26084cf8171a74dcd" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:4.294ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       over the interval
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle [-a,a]}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mo stretchy="false">
              [
             </mo>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              ]
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle [-a,a]}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="[-a,a]" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/50ccbcece37f9ec0a4c6d396be3a143a0b76d5c1" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:6.595ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
       </span>
       will be the area of the ellipse:
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}A_{\text{ellipse}}&amp;=\int _{-a}^{a}2b{\sqrt {1-x^{2}/a^{2}}}\,dx\\&amp;={\frac {b}{a}}\int _{-a}^{a}2{\sqrt {a^{2}-x^{2}}}\,dx.\end{aligned}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" columnspacing="0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="3pt">
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <msub>
                   <mi>
                    A
                   </mi>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mtext>
                     ellipse
                    </mtext>
                   </mrow>
                  </msub>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <msubsup>
                   <mo>
                    ∫
                    <!-- ∫ -->
                   </mo>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mo>
                     −
                     <!-- − -->
                    </mo>
                    <mi>
                     a
                    </mi>
                   </mrow>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mi>
                     a
                    </mi>
                   </mrow>
                  </msubsup>
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                  <mi>
                   b
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <msqrt>
                    <mn>
                     1
                    </mn>
                    <mo>
                     −
                     <!-- − -->
                    </mo>
                    <msup>
                     <mi>
                      x
                     </mi>
                     <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                      <mn>
                       2
                      </mn>
                     </mrow>
                    </msup>
                    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                     <mo>
                      /
                     </mo>
                    </mrow>
                    <msup>
                     <mi>
                      a
                     </mi>
                     <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                      <mn>
                       2
                      </mn>
                     </mrow>
                    </msup>
                   </msqrt>
                  </mrow>
                  <mspace width="thinmathspace">
                  </mspace>
                  <mi>
                   d
                  </mi>
                  <mi>
                   x
                  </mi>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mfrac>
                    <mi>
                     b
                    </mi>
                    <mi>
                     a
                    </mi>
                   </mfrac>
                  </mrow>
                  <msubsup>
                   <mo>
                    ∫
                    <!-- ∫ -->
                   </mo>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mo>
                     −
                     <!-- − -->
                    </mo>
                    <mi>
                     a
                    </mi>
                   </mrow>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mi>
                     a
                    </mi>
                   </mrow>
                  </msubsup>
                  <mn>
                   2
                  </mn>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <msqrt>
                    <msup>
                     <mi>
                      a
                     </mi>
                     <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                      <mn>
                       2
                      </mn>
                     </mrow>
                    </msup>
                    <mo>
                     −
                     <!-- − -->
                    </mo>
                    <msup>
                     <mi>
                      x
                     </mi>
                     <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                      <mn>
                       2
                      </mn>
                     </mrow>
                    </msup>
                   </msqrt>
                  </mrow>
                  <mspace width="thinmathspace">
                  </mspace>
                  <mi>
                   d
                  </mi>
                  <mi>
                   x
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   .
                  </mo>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
               </mtable>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}A_{\text{ellipse}}&amp;=\int _{-a}^{a}2b{\sqrt {1-x^{2}/a^{2}}}\,dx\\&amp;={\frac {b}{a}}\int _{-a}^{a}2{\sqrt {a^{2}-x^{2}}}\,dx.\end{aligned}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\begin{aligned}A_{\text{ellipse}}&amp;=\int _{-a}^{a}2b{\sqrt {1-x^{2}/a^{2}}}\,dx\\&amp;={\frac {b}{a}}\int _{-a}^{a}2{\sqrt {a^{2}-x^{2}}}\,dx.\end{aligned}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/758933e120f925354d0561b94a3c544413d5ebea" style="vertical-align: -5.505ex; width:31.529ex; height:12.176ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The second integral is the area of a circle of radius
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a,}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo>
              ,
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a,}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="a," aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f059f053fcf9f421b7c74362cf3bd5ed024e19d1" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:1.877ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       that is,
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \pi a^{2}.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              .
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \pi a^{2}.}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle \pi a^{2}.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/582e5e8673e6fb95153672c7592026632abddc74" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:4.263ex; height:2.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       So
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}={\frac {b}{a}}\pi a^{2}=\pi ab.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                A
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mtext>
                 ellipse
                </mtext>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mi>
                 b
                </mi>
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mi>
               π
               <!-- π -->
              </mi>
              <msup>
               <mi>
                a
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mn>
                 2
                </mn>
               </mrow>
              </msup>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mi>
               π
               <!-- π -->
              </mi>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               b
              </mi>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}={\frac {b}{a}}\pi a^{2}=\pi ab.}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle A_{\text{ellipse}}={\frac {b}{a}}\pi a^{2}=\pi ab.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/72bc01716684d17a4ca938dab82ad6e62ed51ce7" style="vertical-align: -1.838ex; width:22.455ex; height:5.343ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       An ellipse defined implicitly by
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle Ax^{2}+Bxy+Cy^{2}=1}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              A
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               x
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mi>
              B
             </mi>
             <mi>
              x
             </mi>
             <mi>
              y
             </mi>
             <mo>
              +
             </mo>
             <mi>
              C
             </mi>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               y
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle Ax^{2}+Bxy+Cy^{2}=1}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle Ax^{2}+Bxy+Cy^{2}=1}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/d82f2121fb477ce0d07cbf7763ba207a2827e926" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:22.299ex; height:3.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       has area
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle 2\pi /{\sqrt {4AC-B^{2}}}.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              π
              <!-- π -->
             </mi>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mo>
               /
              </mo>
             </mrow>
             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <msqrt>
               <mn>
                4
               </mn>
               <mi>
                A
               </mi>
               <mi>
                C
               </mi>
               <mo>
                −
                <!-- − -->
               </mo>
               <msup>
                <mi>
                 B
                </mi>
                <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                 <mn>
                  2
                 </mn>
                </mrow>
               </msup>
              </msqrt>
             </mrow>
             <mo>
              .
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle 2\pi /{\sqrt {4AC-B^{2}}}.}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle 2\pi /{\sqrt {4AC-B^{2}}}.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/9c14fda4e679881a6c524bda3db37e988bc061fe" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:16.958ex; height:3.509ex;"/>
       </span>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Circumference">
        Circumference
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=28" title="Edit section: Circumference">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Circumference" title="Circumference">
        circumference
       </a>
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle C}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              C
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle C}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="C" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/4fc55753007cd3c18576f7933f6f089196732029" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.766ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       of an ellipse is:
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle C=4aE(e)}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               C
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mn>
               4
              </mn>
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
              <mi>
               E
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               e
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle C=4aE(e)}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="C=4aE(e)" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/432d11a999e9baaceef8bdd2bf1ae241e4167f7d" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:11.925ex; height:2.843ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       where again
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
