                     </mi>
                    </mrow>
                   </mfrac>
                  </mrow>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <msub>
                   <mi>
                    Y
                   </mi>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mi>
                     c
                    </mi>
                   </mrow>
                  </msub>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mfrac>
                    <mrow>
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                     <mi>
                      A
                     </mi>
                     <mi>
                      E
                     </mi>
                     <mo>
                      −
                      <!-- − -->
                     </mo>
                     <mi>
                      B
                     </mi>
                     <mi>
                      D
                     </mi>
                    </mrow>
                    <mrow>
                     <msup>
                      <mi>
                       B
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mn>
                        2
                       </mn>
                      </mrow>
                     </msup>
                     <mo>
                      −
                      <!-- − -->
                     </mo>
                     <mn>
                      4
                     </mn>
                     <mi>
                      A
                     </mi>
                     <mi>
                      C
                     </mi>
                    </mrow>
                   </mfrac>
                  </mrow>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi mathvariant="normal">
                   Θ
                   <!-- Θ -->
                  </mi>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mrow>
                    <mo>
                     {
                    </mo>
                    <mtable columnalign="left left" columnspacing="1em" displaystyle="false" rowspacing=".2em">
                     <mtr>
                      <mtd>
                       <mn>
                        0
                       </mn>
                      </mtd>
                      <mtd>
                       <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                        <mtext>
                         for
                        </mtext>
                       </mrow>
                       <mi>
                        B
                       </mi>
                       <mo>
                        =
                       </mo>
                       <mn>
                        0
                       </mn>
                       <mo>
                        ,
                       </mo>
                       <mi>
                        A
                       </mi>
                       <mo>
                        &lt;
                       </mo>
                       <mi>
                        C
                       </mi>
                      </mtd>
                     </mtr>
                     <mtr>
                      <mtd>
                       <msup>
                        <mn>
                         90
                        </mn>
                        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                         <mo>
                          ∘
                          <!-- ∘ -->
                         </mo>
                        </mrow>
                       </msup>
                      </mtd>
                      <mtd>
                       <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                        <mtext>
                         for
                        </mtext>
                       </mrow>
                       <mi>
                        B
                       </mi>
                       <mo>
                        =
                       </mo>
                       <mn>
                        0
                       </mn>
                       <mo>
                        ,
                       </mo>
                       <mi>
                        A
                       </mi>
                       <mo>
                        &gt;
                       </mo>
                       <mi>
                        C
                       </mi>
                      </mtd>
                     </mtr>
                     <mtr>
                      <mtd>
                       <mi>
                        arctan
                       </mi>
                       <mo>
                        ⁡
                        <!-- ⁡ -->
                       </mo>
                       <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                        <mfrac>
                         <mrow>
                          <mi>
                           C
                          </mi>
                          <mo>
                           −
                           <!-- − -->
                          </mo>
                          <mi>
                           A
                          </mi>
                          <mo>
                           −
                           <!-- − -->
                          </mo>
                          <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                           <msqrt>
                            <mo stretchy="false">
                             (
                            </mo>
                            <mi>
                             A
                            </mi>
                            <mo>
                             −
                             <!-- − -->
                            </mo>
                            <mi>
                             C
                            </mi>
                            <msup>
                             <mo stretchy="false">
                              )
                             </mo>
                             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                              <mn>
                               2
                              </mn>
                             </mrow>
                            </msup>
                            <mo>
                             +
                            </mo>
                            <msup>
                             <mi>
                              B
                             </mi>
                             <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                              <mn>
                               2
                              </mn>
                             </mrow>
                            </msup>
                           </msqrt>
                          </mrow>
                         </mrow>
                         <mi>
                          B
                         </mi>
                        </mfrac>
                       </mrow>
                      </mtd>
                      <mtd>
                       <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                        <mtext>
                         for
                        </mtext>
                       </mrow>
                       <mi>
                        B
                       </mi>
                       <mo>
                        ≠
                        <!-- ≠ -->
                       </mo>
                       <mn>
                        0
                       </mn>
                      </mtd>
                     </mtr>
                    </mtable>
                    <mo fence="true" stretchy="true" symmetric="true">
                    </mo>
                   </mrow>
                  </mrow>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
               </mtable>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}a,b&amp;={\frac {-{\sqrt {2{\Big (}AE^{2}+CD^{2}-BDE+(B^{2}-4AC)F{\Big )}\left(A+C\pm {\sqrt {(A-C)^{2}+B^{2}}}\right)}}}{B^{2}-4AC}}\\X_{c}&amp;={\frac {2CD-BE}{B^{2}-4AC}}\\Y_{c}&amp;={\frac {2AE-BD}{B^{2}-4AC}}\\\Theta &amp;={\begin{cases}0&amp;{\text{for }}B=0,A&lt;C\\90^{\circ }&amp;{\text{for }}B=0,A&gt;C\\\arctan {\frac {C-A-{\sqrt {(A-C)^{2}+B^{2}}}}{B}}&amp;{\text{for }}B\neq 0\end{cases}}\end{aligned}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}a,b&amp;={\frac {-{\sqrt {2{\Big (}AE^{2}+CD^{2}-BDE+(B^{2}-4AC)F{\Big )}\left(A+C\pm {\sqrt {(A-C)^{2}+B^{2}}}\right)}}}{B^{2}-4AC}}\\X_{c}&amp;={\frac {2CD-BE}{B^{2}-4AC}}\\Y_{c}&amp;={\frac {2AE-BD}{B^{2}-4AC}}\\\Theta &amp;={\begin{cases}0&amp;{\text{for }}B=0,A&lt;C\\90^{\circ }&amp;{\text{for }}B=0,A&gt;C\\\arctan {\frac {C-A-{\sqrt {(A-C)^{2}+B^{2}}}}{B}}&amp;{\text{for }}B\neq 0\end{cases}}\end{aligned}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/1cb40ee9fd5cd89d32cb628804cd4b4ad0320dcf" style="vertical-align: -15.671ex; width:82.122ex; height:32.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       where
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \Theta }" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              Θ
              <!-- Θ -->
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \Theta }
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="\Theta " aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/bc927b19f46d005b4720db7a0f96cd5b6f1a0d9b" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.808ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       is the angle from the positive horizontal axis to the ellipse's major axis.
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Polar_forms">
        Polar forms
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=33" title="Edit section: Polar forms">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Polar_form_relative_to_center">
        Polar form relative to center
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=34" title="Edit section: Polar form relative to center">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_Polar_center.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="220" data-file-width="350" height="138" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/Ellipse_Polar_center.svg/220px-Ellipse_Polar_center.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/Ellipse_Polar_center.svg/330px-Ellipse_Polar_center.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/Ellipse_Polar_center.svg/440px-Ellipse_Polar_center.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_Polar_center.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Polar coordinates centered at the center
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       In
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Polar_coordinates" title="Polar coordinates">
        polar coordinates
       </a>
       , with the origin at the center of the ellipse and with the angular coordinate
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \theta }" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              θ
              <!-- θ -->
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \theta }
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="\theta " aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/6e5ab2664b422d53eb0c7df3b87e1360d75ad9af" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.09ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       measured from the major axis, the ellipse's equation is
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Lawrence_15-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Lawrence-15">
         [15]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        :
        <span>
         p. 75
        </span>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle r(\theta )={\frac {ab}{\sqrt {(b\cos \theta )^{2}+(a\sin \theta )^{2}}}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               r
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               θ
               <!-- θ -->
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                </mrow>
                <msqrt>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  (
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  b
                 </mi>
                 <mi>
                  cos
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  ⁡
                  <!-- ⁡ -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  θ
                  <!-- θ -->
                 </mi>
                 <msup>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   )
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                 <mo>
                  +
                 </mo>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  (
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mi>
                  sin
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  ⁡
                  <!-- ⁡ -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  θ
                  <!-- θ -->
                 </mi>
                 <msup>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   )
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                </msqrt>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle r(\theta )={\frac {ab}{\sqrt {(b\cos \theta )^{2}+(a\sin \theta )^{2}}}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="r(\theta )={\frac {ab}{\sqrt {(b\cos \theta )^{2}+(a\sin \theta )^{2}}}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/6259ba2849e0c42d420e16e88e4abc763a64ab32" style="vertical-align: -3.171ex; width:30.698ex; height:6.676ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Polar_form_relative_to_focus">
        Polar form relative to focus
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=35" title="Edit section: Polar form relative to focus">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_Polar.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="220" data-file-width="350" height="138" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Ellipse_Polar.svg/220px-Ellipse_Polar.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Ellipse_Polar.svg/330px-Ellipse_Polar.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Ellipse_Polar.svg/440px-Ellipse_Polar.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_Polar.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Polar coordinates centered at focus
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       If instead we use polar coordinates with the origin at one focus, with the angular coordinate
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \theta =0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              θ
              <!-- θ -->
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \theta =0}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="\theta =0" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/2a7bc6e34b53e0e8a8815159c356b1acccf7ea24" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:5.351ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       still measured from the major axis, the ellipse's equation is
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle r(\theta )={\frac {a(1-e^{2})}{1\pm e\cos \theta }}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               r
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               (
              </mo>
              <mi>
               θ
               <!-- θ -->
              </mi>
              <mo stretchy="false">
               )
              </mo>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  (
                 </mo>
                 <mn>
                  1
                 </mn>
                 <mo>
                  −
                  <!-- − -->
                 </mo>
                 <msup>
                  <mi>
                   e
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  )
                 </mo>
                </mrow>
                <mrow>
                 <mn>
                  1
                 </mn>
                 <mo>
                  ±
                  <!-- ± -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  e
                 </mi>
                 <mi>
                  cos
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  ⁡
                  <!-- ⁡ -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  θ
                  <!-- θ -->
                 </mi>
                </mrow>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle r(\theta )={\frac {a(1-e^{2})}{1\pm e\cos \theta }}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle r(\theta )={\frac {a(1-e^{2})}{1\pm e\cos \theta }}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ce854b0567e04582334d963cce256d81717693bd" style="vertical-align: -2.005ex; width:17.945ex; height:6.009ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       where the sign in the denominator is negative if the reference direction
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \theta =0}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              θ
              <!-- θ -->
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              0
             </mn>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \theta =0}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="\theta =0" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/2a7bc6e34b53e0e8a8815159c356b1acccf7ea24" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:5.351ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       points towards the center (as illustrated on the right), and positive if that direction points away from the center.
      </p>
      <p>
       In the slightly more general case of an ellipse with one focus at the origin and the other focus at angular coordinate
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \phi }" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              ϕ
              <!-- ϕ -->
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \phi }
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="\phi " aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/72b1f30316670aee6270a28334bdf4f5072cdde4" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:1.385ex; height:2.509ex;"/>
       </span>
       , the polar form is
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle r={\frac {a(1-e^{2})}{1-e\cos(\theta -\phi )}}.}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               r
              </mi>
              <mo>
               =
              </mo>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                 <mi>
                  a
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  (
                 </mo>
                 <mn>
                  1
                 </mn>
                 <mo>
                  −
                  <!-- − -->
                 </mo>
                 <msup>
                  <mi>
                   e
                  </mi>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mn>
                    2
                   </mn>
                  </mrow>
                 </msup>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  )
                 </mo>
                </mrow>
                <mrow>
                 <mn>
                  1
                 </mn>
                 <mo>
                  −
                  <!-- − -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  e
                 </mi>
                 <mi>
                  cos
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  ⁡
                  <!-- ⁡ -->
                 </mo>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  (
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  θ
                  <!-- θ -->
                 </mi>
                 <mo>
                  −
                  <!-- − -->
                 </mo>
                 <mi>
                  ϕ
                  <!-- ϕ -->
                 </mi>
                 <mo stretchy="false">
                  )
                 </mo>
                </mrow>
               </mfrac>
              </mrow>
              <mo>
               .
              </mo>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle r={\frac {a(1-e^{2})}{1-e\cos(\theta -\phi )}}.}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\displaystyle r={\frac {a(1-e^{2})}{1-e\cos(\theta -\phi )}}.}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/e8445a2a64e667e0f2b47bd8c448507b0fc72cbd" style="vertical-align: -2.671ex; width:21.34ex; height:6.676ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       The angle
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle \theta }" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              θ
              <!-- θ -->
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle \theta }
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="\theta " aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/6e5ab2664b422d53eb0c7df3b87e1360d75ad9af" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.09ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       in these formulas is called the
       <b>
        <a href="/wiki/True_anomaly" title="True anomaly">
         true anomaly
        </a>
       </b>
       of the point. The numerator
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a(1-e^{2})}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              (
             </mo>
             <mn>
              1
             </mn>
             <mo>
              −
              <!-- − -->
             </mo>
             <msup>
              <mi>
               e
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mn>
                2
               </mn>
              </mrow>
             </msup>
             <mo stretchy="false">
              )
             </mo>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a(1-e^{2})}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle a(1-e^{2})}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/dbb340cf9657b20eff278ce5989aaae8669a2c07" style="vertical-align: -0.838ex; width:9.18ex; height:3.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       of these formulas is the
       <b>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Semi-latus_rectum" title="Semi-latus rectum">
         semi-latus rectum
        </a>
       </b>
       of the ellipse, usually denoted
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle l}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              l
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle l}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="l" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/829091f745070b9eb97a80244129025440a1cfac" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.693ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       . It is the distance from a focus of the ellipse to the ellipse itself, measured along a line
       <a href="/wiki/Perpendicular" title="Perpendicular">
        perpendicular
       </a>
       to the major axis.
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid">
        Ellipse as hypotrochoid
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=36" title="Edit section: Ellipse as hypotrochoid">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid.gif">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="400" height="220" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid.gif/220px-Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid.gif" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid.gif/330px-Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid.gif 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/5/5c/Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid.gif 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Ellipse_as_hypotrochoid.gif" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         An ellipse (in red) as a special case of the
         <a href="/wiki/Hypotrochoid" title="Hypotrochoid">
          hypotrochoid
         </a>
         with
         <i>
          R
         </i>
         = 2
         <i>
          r
         </i>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The ellipse is a special case of the
       <a href="/wiki/Hypotrochoid" title="Hypotrochoid">
        hypotrochoid
       </a>
       when
       <i>
        R
       </i>
       = 2
       <i>
        r
       </i>
       , as shown in the adjacent image. The special case of a moving circle with radius
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle r}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              r
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle r}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="r" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/0d1ecb613aa2984f0576f70f86650b7c2a132538" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.049ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       inside a circle with radius
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle R=2r}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              R
             </mi>
             <mo>
              =
             </mo>
             <mn>
              2
             </mn>
             <mi>
              r
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle R=2r}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="{\displaystyle R=2r}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/724f22a06637c1db11f52f5e3ac84d18ac8b9073" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:7.074ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       is called a
       <a href="/wiki/Tusi_couple" title="Tusi couple">
        Tusi couple
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Ellipses_as_plane_sections_of_quadrics">
        Ellipses as plane sections of quadrics
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=37" title="Edit section: Ellipses as plane sections of quadrics">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <p>
       Ellipses appear as plane sections of the following
       <a href="/wiki/Quadric" title="Quadric">
        quadrics
       </a>
       :
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Ellipsoid" title="Ellipsoid">
         Ellipsoid
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        Elliptic
        <a href="/wiki/Cone" title="Cone">
         cone
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        Elliptic
        <a href="/wiki/Cylinder" title="Cylinder">
         cylinder
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hyperboloid_of_one_sheet" title="Hyperboloid of one sheet">
         Hyperboloid of one sheet
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hyperboloid_of_two_sheets" title="Hyperboloid of two sheets">
         Hyperboloid of two sheets
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <ul class="gallery mw-gallery-traditional">
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 155px">
        <div style="width: 155px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 150px;">
          <div style="margin:15px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ellipsoid_Quadric.png">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="829" data-file-width="750" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Ellipsoid_Quadric.png/109px-Ellipsoid_Quadric.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Ellipsoid_Quadric.png/163px-Ellipsoid_Quadric.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Ellipsoid_Quadric.png/217px-Ellipsoid_Quadric.png 2x" width="109"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           Ellipsoid
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 155px">
        <div style="width: 155px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 150px;">

          </p>

        </div>

       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 155px">

          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 155px">

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Applications">
        Applications
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=38" title="Edit section: Applications">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Physics">
        Physics
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=39" title="Edit section: Physics">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Elliptical_reflectors_and_acoustics">
        Elliptical reflectors and acoustics
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=40" title="Edit section: Elliptical reflectors and acoustics">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a href="/wiki/Fresnel_zone" title="Fresnel zone">
        Fresnel zone
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       If the water's surface is disturbed at one focus of an elliptical water tank, the circular waves of that disturbance, after
       <a href="/wiki/Reflection_(physics)" title="Reflection (physics)">
        reflecting
       </a>
       off the walls, converge simultaneously to a single point: the
       <i>
        second focus
       </i>
       . This is a consequence of the total travel length being the same along any wall-bouncing path between the two foci.
      </p>
      <p>
       Similarly, if a light source is placed at one focus of an elliptic
       <a href="/wiki/Mirror" title="Mirror">
        mirror
       </a>
       , all light rays on the plane of the ellipse are reflected to the second focus. Since no other smooth curve has such a property, it can be used as an alternative definition of an ellipse. (In the special case of a circle with a source at its center all light would be reflected back to the center.) If the ellipse is rotated along its major axis to produce an
       <a href="/wiki/Ellipsoid" title="Ellipsoid">
        ellipsoidal
       </a>
       mirror (specifically, a
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Prolate_spheroid" title="Prolate spheroid">
        prolate spheroid
       </a>
       ), this property holds for all rays out of the source. Alternatively, a cylindrical mirror with elliptical cross-section can be used to focus light from a linear
       <a href="/wiki/Fluorescent_lamp" title="Fluorescent lamp">
        fluorescent lamp
       </a>
       along a line of the paper; such mirrors are used in some
       <a href="/wiki/Image_scanner" title="Image scanner">
        document scanners
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       Sound waves are reflected in a similar way, so in a large elliptical room a person standing at one focus can hear a person standing at the other focus remarkably well. The effect is even more evident under a
       <a href="/wiki/Cupola" title="Cupola">
        vaulted roof
       </a>
       shaped as a section of a prolate spheroid. Such a room is called a
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Whisper_chamber" title="Whisper chamber">
         whisper chamber
        </a>
       </i>
       . The same effect can be demonstrated with two reflectors shaped like the end caps of such a spheroid, placed facing each other at the proper distance. Examples are the
       <a href="/wiki/National_Statuary_Hall" title="National Statuary Hall">
        National Statuary Hall
       </a>
       at the
       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Capitol" title="United States Capitol">
        United States Capitol
       </a>
       (where
       <a href="/wiki/John_Quincy_Adams" title="John Quincy Adams">
        John Quincy Adams
       </a>
       is said to have used this property for eavesdropping on political matters); the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mormon_Tabernacle" title="Mormon Tabernacle">
        Mormon Tabernacle
       </a>
       at
       <a href="/wiki/Temple_Square" title="Temple Square">
        Temple Square
       </a>
       in
       <a href="/wiki/Salt_Lake_City" title="Salt Lake City">
        Salt Lake City
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Utah" title="Utah">
        Utah
       </a>
       ; at an exhibit on sound at the
       <a href="/wiki/Museum_of_Science_and_Industry_(Chicago)" title="Museum of Science and Industry (Chicago)">
        Museum of Science and Industry
       </a>
       in
       <a href="/wiki/Chicago" title="Chicago">
        Chicago
       </a>
       ; in front of the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/University_of_Illinois_at_Urbana-Champaign" title="University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign">
        University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
       </a>
       Foellinger Auditorium; and also at a side chamber of the Palace of Charles V, in the
       <a href="/wiki/Alhambra" title="Alhambra">
        Alhambra
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Planetary_orbits">
        Planetary orbits
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ellipse&amp;action=edit&amp;section=41" title="Edit section: Planetary orbits">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Elliptic_orbit" title="Elliptic orbit">
        Elliptic orbit
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       In the 17th century,
       <a href="/wiki/Johannes_Kepler" title="Johannes Kepler">
        Johannes Kepler
       </a>
       discovered that the orbits along which the planets travel around the Sun are ellipses with the Sun [approximately] at one focus, in his
       <a href="/wiki/Kepler%27s_laws_of_planetary_motion" title="Kepler's laws of planetary motion">
        first law of planetary motion
       </a>
       . Later,
       <a href="/wiki/Isaac_Newton" title="Isaac Newton">
        Isaac Newton
       </a>
       explained this as a corollary of his
       <a href="/wiki/Newton%27s_law_of_universal_gravitation" title="Newton's law of universal gravitation">
        law of universal gravitation
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       More generally, in the gravitational
       <a href="/wiki/Two-body_problem" title="Two-body problem">
        two-body problem
       </a>
       , if the two bodies are bound to each other (that is, the total energy is negative), their orbits are
       <a href="/wiki/Similarity_(geometry)" title="Similarity (geometry)">
        similar
       </a>
       ellipses with the common
       <a href="/wiki/Barycenter" title="Barycenter">
        barycenter
       </a>
       being one of the foci of each ellipse. The other focus of either ellipse has no known physical significance. Interestingly, the orbit of either body in the reference frame of the other is also an ellipse, with the other body at the same focus.
      </p>
      <p>
       Keplerian elliptical orbits are the result of any radially directed attraction force whose strength is inversely proportional to the square of the distance. Thus, in principle, the motion of two oppositely charged particles in empty space would also be an ellipse. (However, this conclusion ignores losses due to
       <a href="/wiki/Electromagnetic_radiation" title="Electromagnetic radiation">
        electromagnetic radiation
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Quantum_mechanics" title="Quantum mechanics">
        quantum effects
       </a>
       , which become significant when the particles are moving at high speed.)
      </p>
      <p>
       For
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Elliptical_orbit" title="Elliptical orbit">
        elliptical orbits
       </a>
       , useful relations involving the eccentricity
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle e}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              e
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle e}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="e" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/cd253103f0876afc68ebead27a5aa9867d927467" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.083ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       are:
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}e&amp;={\frac {r_{a}-r_{p}}{r_{a}+r_{p}}}={\frac {r_{a}-r_{p}}{2a}}\\r_{a}&amp;=(1+e)a\\r_{p}&amp;=(1-e)a\end{aligned}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" columnspacing="0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="3pt">
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                   e
                  </mi>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mfrac>
                    <mrow>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>
                        a
                       </mi>
                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                     <mo>
                      −
                      <!-- − -->
                     </mo>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>
                        p
                       </mi>
                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                    </mrow>
                    <mrow>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>
                        a
                       </mi>
                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                     <mo>
                      +
                     </mo>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>
                        p
                       </mi>
                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                    </mrow>
                   </mfrac>
                  </mrow>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mfrac>
                    <mrow>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>
                        a
                       </mi>
                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                     <mo>
                      −
                      <!-- − -->
                     </mo>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>
                        p
                       </mi>
                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                    </mrow>
                    <mrow>
                     <mn>
                      2
                     </mn>
                     <mi>
                      a
                     </mi>
                    </mrow>
                   </mfrac>
                  </mrow>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <msub>
                   <mi>
                    r
                   </mi>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mi>
                     a
                    </mi>
                   </mrow>
                  </msub>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   (
                  </mo>
                  <mn>
                   1
                  </mn>
                  <mo>
                   +
                  </mo>
                  <mi>
                   e
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   )
                  </mo>
                  <mi>
                   a
                  </mi>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <msub>
                   <mi>
                    r
                   </mi>
                   <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                    <mi>
                     p
                    </mi>
                   </mrow>
                  </msub>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   (
                  </mo>
                  <mn>
                   1
                  </mn>
                  <mo>
                   −
                   <!-- − -->
                  </mo>
                  <mi>
                   e
                  </mi>
                  <mo stretchy="false">
                   )
                  </mo>
                  <mi>
                   a
                  </mi>
                 </mtd>
                </mtr>
               </mtable>
              </mrow>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}e&amp;={\frac {r_{a}-r_{p}}{r_{a}+r_{p}}}={\frac {r_{a}-r_{p}}{2a}}\\r_{a}&amp;=(1+e)a\\r_{p}&amp;=(1-e)a\end{aligned}}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="{\begin{aligned}e&amp;={\frac {r_{a}-r_{p}}{r_{a}+r_{p}}}={\frac {r_{a}-r_{p}}{2a}}\\r_{a}&amp;=(1+e)a\\r_{p}&amp;=(1-e)a\end{aligned}}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/a77dbb190ea1e2efdf61a8c866df331d463081b0" style="vertical-align: -5.671ex; width:24.969ex; height:12.509ex;"/>
        </span>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       where
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle r_{a}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                r
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 a
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle r_{a}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="r_{a}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/da5f0781a46ba20129a554237056b6ade78b956f" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.151ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
        </span>
        is the radius at
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Apoapsis" title="Apoapsis">
         apoapsis
        </a>
        (the farthest distance)
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle r_{p}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <msub>
               <mi>
                r
               </mi>
               <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                <mi>
                 p
                </mi>
               </mrow>
              </msub>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle r_{p}}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="r_{p}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/d02ec163fac8837ac757005d783b375e52808b97" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:2.108ex; height:2.343ex;"/>
        </span>
        is the radius at
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Periapsis" title="Periapsis">
         periapsis
        </a>
        (the closest distance)
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mi>
               a
              </mi>
             </mstyle>
            </mrow>
            <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
             {\displaystyle a}
            </annotation>
           </semantics>
          </math>
         </span>
         <img alt="a" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ffd2487510aa438433a2579450ab2b3d557e5edc" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.23ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
        </span>
        is the length of the
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Semi-major_axis" title="Semi-major axis">
         semi-major axis
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Also, in terms of
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle r_{a}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               r
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi>
                a
               </mi>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle r_{a}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="r_{a}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/da5f0781a46ba20129a554237056b6ade78b956f" style="vertical-align: -0.671ex; width:2.151ex; height:2.009ex;"/>
       </span>
       and
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle r_{p}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <msub>
              <mi>
               r
              </mi>
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mi>
                p
               </mi>
              </mrow>
             </msub>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle r_{p}}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="r_{p}" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/d02ec163fac8837ac757005d783b375e52808b97" style="vertical-align: -1.005ex; width:2.108ex; height:2.343ex;"/>
       </span>
       , the semi-major axis
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle a}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              a
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle a}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="a" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/ffd2487510aa438433a2579450ab2b3d557e5edc" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:1.23ex; height:1.676ex;"/>
       </span>
       is their
       <a href="/wiki/Arithmetic_mean" title="Arithmetic mean">
        arithmetic mean
       </a>
       , the semi-minor axis
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle b}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              b
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle b}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="b" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/f11423fbb2e967f986e36804a8ae4271734917c3" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.998ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       is their
       <a href="/wiki/Geometric_mean" title="Geometric mean">
        geometric mean
       </a>
       , and the
       <a href="/wiki/Conic_section#Features" title="Conic section">
        semi-latus rectum
       </a>
       <span class="mwe-math-element">
        <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
         <math alttext="{\displaystyle l}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
          <semantics>
           <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
            <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
             <mi>
              l
             </mi>
            </mstyle>
           </mrow>
           <annotation encoding="application/x-tex">
            {\displaystyle l}
           </annotation>
          </semantics>
         </math>
        </span>
        <img alt="l" aria-hidden="true" class="mwe-math-fallback-image-inline" src="https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/media/math/render/svg/829091f745070b9eb97a80244129025440a1cfac" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex; width:0.693ex; height:2.176ex;"/>
       </span>
       is their
       <a href="/wiki/Harmonic_mean" title="Harmonic mean">
        harmonic mean
       </a>
       . In other words,
      </p>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <span class="mwe-math-element">
         <span class="mwe-math-mathml-inline mwe-math-mathml-a11y" style="display: none;">
          <math alttext="{\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}a&amp;={\frac {r_{a}+r_{p}}{2}}\\b&amp;={\sqrt {r_{a}\cdot r_{p}}}\\l&amp;={\frac {2}{{\frac {1}{r_{a}}}+{\frac {1}{r_{p}}}}}={\frac {2r_{a}r_{p}}{r_{a}+r_{p}}}\end{aligned}}}" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
           <semantics>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
             <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0">
              <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
               <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" columnspacing="0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em 2em 0em" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="3pt">
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                   a
                  </mi>
                 </mtd>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                  </mi>
                  <mo>
                   =
                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                   <mfrac>
                    <mrow>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>

                       </mi>
                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                     <mo>
                      +
                     </mo>
                     <msub>
                      <mi>
                       r
                      </mi>
                      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
                       <mi>

                      </mrow>
                     </msub>
                    </mrow>
                    <mn>
                     2
                    </mn>

                  </mrow>

                </mtr>
                <mtr>
                 <mtd>
                  <mi>
                   b

                  </mo>
                  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
